Jubilee supporters protest against the remarks by Embakasi East MMP Babu Owino against the president. The protesters burnt tyres in Kiambu. The protest occurred 'at the weekend.'
Al Shabaab militants who attempted to carry out an attack were driven out by the officers from the Rural Border Patrol Unit on Monday.
Jubilee supporters who gathered in Bungoma were chased away by NASA supporters. No evidence of violence.
NASA protesters and police outside the Supreme Court were on Wednesday attacked by a swarm of bees and forced to flee amidst the issuing of the full ruling by Supreme Court Judges
Supporters of President Kenyatta protest against the Supreme Court's decision to annul the elections in the strongholds of Nakuru, Kikuyu, Nyeri and Eldoret towns

Supporters of President Kenyatta protest against the Supreme Court's decision to annul the elections in the strongholds of Nakuru, Kikuyu, Nyeri and Eldoret towns. Jubilee supporters in Nyeri town demanded the Supreme Court to order recount of votes of the presidential elections. The demo was held as Kenyans await the full judgment of the court.

Pro-Jubilee protesters blocked the road to the Kerugoya Law Courts and burned an effigy of Narc-Kenya leader Martha Karua for the hearing of her petition against the election of Kirinyaga governor Anne Waiguru of the Jubilee coalition. Anti-riot police were called in to disperse the rowdy protesters.
Protesters outside the Supreme Court waved placards against Chief Justice David Maraga whom they accuse of slowing the country's development after nullification of President Uhuru Kenyatta's victory
Supporters of President Kenyatta protest against the Supreme Court's decision to annul the elections in the strongholds of Nakuru, Kikuyu, Nyeri and Eldoret towns

Supporters of President Kenyatta protest against the Supreme Court's decision to annul the elections in the strongholds of Nakuru, Kikuyu, Nyeri and Eldoret towns. In Nakuru, protestors barricaded the Nakuru-Nairobi highway, paralysing transport.
At least 28 houses have been burnt down in Kaloleni Estate, Kisumu County, by a group of suspected boda boda operators in search of motorcycle thieves.
Police arrested demonstrators in Keroka town in Nyamira County. The demonstrators were protesting against President Kenyatta's verbal attacks against the judiciary.
6 people were injured when unidentified attackers wielding machetes attacked people in Bumula village, in Bungoma.

Drivers for internet taxi companies held a strike to protest against working conditions. They drove through town and barricaded important roads and the area around the town hall. There were some reports of threats to passers-by.
Police officers used tear gas to disperse a youth group who blocked roads and hurled stones at the police. The youth group accused a group of women of buying voter IDs.

Police in Mwingi shot in the air to disperse angry residents whom had turned against Jubilee Party members on a campaign trail. The group, which carried Raila Odinga and Kalonzo Musyoka's posters, hurled stones at the motorcade smashing windows of several cars.

Drivers for internet taxi companies held a strike to protest against working conditions. They drove through town and barricaded important roads and the area around the town hall. There were some reports of threats to passers-by.
Kenyan nurses held demonstrations across the country.

5 Pokot men were allegedly shot by police officers deployed to flush out bandits who have wreaked havoc in Baringo and Laikipia counties. It is alleged the five were among suspected Pokot bandits behind frequent attacks targeting Tugens, Ilchamus and Marakwets.

A gun battle was reported between police and Al Shabaab militants in Mandera Town Monday morning. Mandera County Commissioner Fredrick Shisia said more security personnel had been deployed to secure the area but could not confirm if there were casualties so far.

Striking nurses protest outside Afya House in Nairobi on September 11, 2017. On the same day, taxi drivers working for Uber, Little, Taxify and Mondo began an indefinite strike in protest of the rates at which they are currently being paid. Tens of drivers gathered outside City Hall in Nairobi, hooting and making their plight known to passers-by.

At least one police officer was killed and two others injured when the vehicle in which they were travelling ran over an improvised explosive device (IED) in the coastal Lamu County on Sunday evening.
Three people have been killed and eight others seriously injured in a banditry attack in Baragoi town, Samburu County

Officers conducting the ongoing multi-agency security Operation in Lamu have discovered and destroyed three key Al-Shabaab hideouts at Lango la Simba in Witu Division of Lamu West. The raids took place on or before 10/09.
Armed raiders killed 2 students and injured 1 man when they attacked a commmunity in Marakwet East.
Unknown people have torched the offices of Homa Bay Governor on Thursday night. Police arrested one person following the incident
Four people were killed by suspected Al Shabaab militia in Lamu county. Police have launched an investigation.
A man in Kaptet, in Marakwet East, was shot dead by an armed group from a neighbouring village.
Residents in Hindi rioted and blockaded the road to protest the killing of people by Al Shabaab. The police fired into the air to disperse the crowd.
Four people were killed by suspected Al Shabaab militia in two villages in the Hindi area in Lamu county. Police have launched an investigation.
Refugees in the Dadaab Camp held a demonstration to protest against the renditioning of refugees to Ethiopia.

Hundreds of Moi Market traders in Thika Town have demonstrated over the allocation of a leisure garden located in the town centre to hawkers who flooded the town since Kiambu Governor Ferdinand Waititu was declared the Jubilee Party prior to the August 8 election
Second day of peaceful protests in NASA's stronghold Kisii over President Uhuru Kenyatta's remarks on Justice David Maraga
Residents of Bonyamatutu village in Nyamira County, the home of Chief Justice Maraga, protest against Kenyatta's verbal attacks on the judiciary.
Peaceful protests in NASA's stronghold Kisii over President Uhuru Kenyatta's remarks on Justice David Maraga
Two Police Officers were killed and their rifles were stolen by unknown gunmen. The two officers were manning the church compound when they were killed.
3 people were injured when a grenade exploded in Eskot market, in Garbatulla. The man carrying the grenade, a 32-year old chemist, was killed whilst holding it.
Police rioted in Kisumu.
Nairobi train workers protested, causing the train service to be suspended.

Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) and police exchanged fire with Al Shabaab militants after they destroyed a telecommunication mast in Mandera County. The police reservists were overpowered by the attackers as they engaged in gunfight but none was injured during the 1:30 a.m. attack at Dabacity area. A loud explosion was heard and police reservists guarding the mast reported an attack at Dabacity by the militants but none of the police reservists was injured in the incident.

Al Shabaab militants ambushed a vehicle travelling from Garsen to Lamu. The vehicle drove over an IED and was then shot at by the militants. 2 people were killed. 50m away, a few hours later, the same Al Shabaab militants fired at a truck, killing 1 person. They also destroyed a nearby electricity pylon.
A soldier opened fire on 2 schoolboys in Rumuruti, killing 1 and injuring the other.

At least two KDF soldiers were killed on 28 August when their Armoured Personnel Carrier (APC) triggered off a roadside bomb explosion in Damasa Lafey Sub-County, Mandera [northeast of the country]. Three others were injured.
A policeman has been apprehended after shooting dead Mwenda Itaeba, a Jubilee politian who had recently lost a primary election.
Residents in Maili Saba, in Dandora, protested against the high levels of banditry attacks in the area.
KSIMU residents and NASA supporters burned banners congratulating President Uhuru Kenyatta's on his win at the 8 August poll. Police intervened with teargas.
Four bodies have been pulled up from a Kisumu beach. The victims were likely killed during the post-electoral violence, it is uncertain as to who killed them.
Supporters of the newly elected Migori governor attacked a government official in the Migori offices. They beat him and threw him out of the office.
Youths armed with sticks and placards stormed the Siaya county offices and evicted civil servants who do not support the new governor.
Residents storm Kaptebeswet Secondary School in Kipchebor Ward after unknown people kill a security guard and a student. It is unknown whether the killings were political, criminal or personal.

Property destruction: Al-Shabab fighters attacked the Kenyan village of Gamba in Tana River County [in the country's coastal region], targeting government installations in the area. The extent of the damage or whether anyone was killed or injured in the attack is not year clear. Phone networks in the area broke down after the raid.
The Kenya Defence Forces [KDF] on Sunday [20 August] resumed bombing Boni Forest which Al Shabaab has used as a base to launch attacks.
Two foreigners of Caucasian origin found dead, bodies dumped by roadside in Mombasa, reasons unknown.

assoc_actor_2: IEBC: Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission; Women (Kenya)
notes: An IEBC official, Caroline Odiga, was killed and her body was dumped in the bushes near a market.
Workers protested at Nairobi's Rift Valley Railways (RVR) offices, saying they will only resume work after they are paid their full July salaries.
Two policemen were Friday afternoon shot dead by unknown gunmen while on patrol at Miti Kenda area in Kibichoi, Kiambu County.
At least three people were killed on Friday by Al Shabaab militants in Witu Lamu County. The Star reports 4 dead.

Anti-terror police shot dead wanted Al Shabaab member Hussein Said Omar. He was one of the Al Shabaab militants behind the Mpeketoni attack that claimed lives of more than 60 people in June 2014. He engaged security personnel in a shootout from his hideout in Bamburi before he was shot dead by the police. The event took place on 18/08 or before.
Al Shabaab militants attacked Maleli village, near Witu town. They burned down houses and killed 4 people.
Women from Boni were abducted and held by Al Shabaab militants in a camp, where they were gang-raped and mistreated.
Baby Pendo was allegedly hit in the head by a police officer using a baton in Nyalenda, Kisumu County, leading to her death on August 15.
When the Jubilee candidate was declared winner of the Garissa governorship, opposition supporters rioted and burned down the Garissa market.

Five police officers have been killed by an Al-Shabaab IED while on patrol along Bothai-Ijara road, within Garissa County. One officer sustained injuries during the attack while another one managed to escape unhurt.

2 police officers were killed in post-election riots in Nairobi. Reports indicate that that incident occurred in Kiambu,where gunmen pumped four bullets into each of the officers before jumping into waiting motorcycles and riding off. The attackers snatched an AK-47 rifle from one of the officers. Suspected Al-Shabaab but not confirmed.
Two people were shot dead by police during the protest against the presidential results. The police reported that they were shot as they attempted to break into a shop Kariobang.
One person was killed in Starehe, Nairobi during the protest against the presidential elections results. Police reported that protesters were breaking into private houses

Two rioters were shot dead by police during the protest against the presidential results. The rioters were armed and trying to break into a supermarket. It is not known whether the rioters belonged to the opposition or were opportunistic.
Riots in Nyanza/Migori from 11 to 13 Aug, a total of 5 people are killed in the area during the time period
One person died during violent protest against the presidential election results in Homa Bay. Five casualty cases were reported by the Kenyan Red Cross Society.
A nine-year-old was allegedly shot by police while on the third floor balcony of a three-storey building in Nairobi's Mathare North Area 2 on August 13.
Clashes erupted on Sunday between ethnic Luo supporters of defeated Kenyan opposition leader Raila Odinga and members of President Uhuru Kenyatta's Kikuyu group in a Nairobi slum.
After the riots in western Kenya, small scale traders in Awendo were counting losses after their kiosks were destroyed by rioters
After the riots in western Kenya, small scale traders in Bondo were counting losses after their kiosks were destroyed by rioters. It was reported that police killed two during the riots.
After the riots in western Kenya, small scale traders in Rongo were counting losses after their kiosks were destroyed by rioters t
Since the announcement of the presidential elections results, one casualty cas was reported by the Kenya Red Cross Society after confrontation between rioters and police in Busia.
Since the announcement of the presidential elections results, nine casualties were reported by the Kenya Red Cross Society after confrontation between rioters and police in Kibera.
Violent electoral protests in Mathare between 9-13 Aug in Mathare

A disabled woman who had been helping the governor during the election campaign was found to have ballot books in her house in Kibera. People from the neighbourhood rioted, burned down her house, and beat her up.

Police shoot dead a construction worker as he steps outside of his house. There were no protests taking place where he was shot. It is also alleged that police purposely shot at people looking at the riots from their buildings, resulting in the death of a child.
Police clash with violent demonstrators on August 10 and 11 and with a smaller group of protestors on August 12.
Riots in Nyanza/Migori from 11 to 13 Aug, a total of 5 people are killed in the area during the time period.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: GSU Police kill two civilians in house-to-house searches in Mathare.

actor2: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: GSU police battle protesters on the 12th.

In Buruburu area in Nairobi and in Kiambu on the outskirts of the capital, police lobbed teargas to disperse two rival groups, one celebrating Kenyatta's victory and the other protesting against his victory.

In Buruburu area in Nairobi and in Kiambu on the outskirts of the capital, police lobbed teargas to disperse two rival groups, one celebrating Kenyatta's victory and the other protesting against his victory.

actor2: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: Scores are injured when a vehicle clashes into Jubilee supporters in Nakuru county. Residents then engage police in running battles.
Youth in Homa Bay protest against police violence by setting fire to market stalls. Included in the destruction was the home of an election chief.
In Ahero township 25 kiosks were torched by rioters protesting the election result.
2 people were killed and 5 people injured in riots in Kisumu to protest the election result, assumed by 'mob justice'

The police conducted a sweeping search for opposition supporters in Nyalenda, Kisumu. They forced their way into homes to beat people. In one home they beat a six-month old baby. She died the following day. At least 10 people were killed in the searches over 2 days (split between 2 events)
Three people are killed by police during protests in Mathare in the Bodeni area against Kenyatta's victory. The protests were marred by violence on both sides.

actor2: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: One is dead following clashes with police in Dandora.

A total of two people killed in Siaya protests after Kenyatta's victory (one fatality coded elsewhere). In Siaya county, relatives and two witnesses said that on August 12, police beat to death 17-year-old Kennedy Juma Otieno, after pursuing him from Kisumu's Busia Road, where they had dispersed protesters with teargas
Since 11 August, Nyanza [western Kenya] experienced a breakout of violence, where rioters engaged the police after the announcement of the presidential elections results.

NASA members protested against the IEBC results in Kisumu, burning old tyers in Obulanga, Mamboleo, Riat and Kondele. Police tried to contain the crowds. In Kondele a man is killed in uncertain circumstances
In Kisumu's Nyamasaria , police shot dead a young man by a petrol station. No mention whether the man was protesting.
One protester is killed by police in Maseno
Reports of pro-opposition protests in Mombasa on 11 Aug. No reports of violence or clashes with police.

During house to house searches in the village of Dago, 25km north of Kisumu, a police officer shot and killed a 21-year-old who was working with Elections Observations Group (ELOG), a Kenyan organization that has observed the past two elections.
NASA members protested against the IEBC results, burning old tyers in Manyatta
NASA members protested against the IEBC results, burning old tyers in Nyalenda. The demonstrators clashed with police and two died.
NASA members protested against the IEBC results in Kisumu, burning old tyers in Obulanga, Mamboleo, Riat and Kondele. Police tried to contain the crowds.

Opposition protesters in Dandorra set fire to local businesses. Police tried to disperse them with tear gas and firing into the air but quickly moved on to firing live ammunition directly at protesters and bystanders, killing at least three.

Police clash with violent protesters on August 10 and 11 and with a smaller group of protestors on August 12. At least two people were killed in circumstances that appear to be unlawful killings, and dozens were shot and injured. One man was killed on the 10th and another was a non-protesting civilian who was beaten to death by the GSU on 11 Aug
Violent electoral protests in Mathare between 9-13 Aug in Mathre

Relatives and a witness said that police shot and killed Zacchaeus Okoth, a 21-year-old man from Anduro village, Siaya county, on the night of August 11, as the police used teargas and live bullets to disperse crowds of protesters after the announcement of Kenyatta's victory.

A six-month-old baby was injured in the head by police during a protest of the election results. The baby later died in hospital. Police reportedly beat also a resident during the protest and harassed journalists that had taken a picture of the incident. Police also conduct door-to-door searches and hospitalise several people in Kisumu.
Opposition demonstrators engage police in running battles after Kenyatta declared the winner of the election, a body is later found in the town

actor2: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: The GSU clash with rioters in the Olympic area near Kibera. Witnesses say that they saw 4 bodies taken away from the clashes.
Election protests occur in Kariobangi on a 11/08. Police involved. At least one death reported.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: Police clash with violent demonstrators on August 10 and 11 and with a smaller group of protestors on August 12. At least two people were killed in circumstances that appear to be unlawful killings, and dozens were shot and injured. One man was killed on the 10th and another was a non-protesting civilian who was beaten to death by the GSU on 11 Aug.

On the evening of August 11 in Babadogo area, moments before Kenyatta was declared winner, police shot dead one boy and two men. Witnesses claimed the three were in the same place as the rioters, but not engaging in rioting.
Four people are killed in the context of riots in Kawangwere on 11 Aug.
Rioters against the presidential election results set grocery stalls on fire. The police dispersed the crowd.
There were riots in Kisumu, which were heavily suppressed by the police.

Police clash with violent protesters on August 10 and 11 and with a smaller group of protestors on August 12. At least two people were killed in circumstances that appear to be unlawful killings, and dozens were shot and injured. One man was killed on the 10th and another was a non-protesting civilian who was beaten to death by the GSU on 11 Aug.
Violent electoral protests in Mathare between 9-13 Aug in Mathare.
Two people from rival political groups fought at Nduru Girls' Secondary School, a tallying centre in South Mugirango constituency.
Police used teargas canisters to disperse clashes between rival political supporters.
Two people die in riots/clashes with police on 10 Aug in Kawangware.

Drama ensued in Lamu West after the returning officer was prevented from announcing the final results for the parliamentary seat. Return was not possible because chaos erupted when the RO and the candidate began fighting, breaking ballot boxes in the process. A number of injuries were reported.
A crowd of people rioted at the Chesoi tallying centre. Police fired into the crowd, killing a 15 year old girl.
ODM Kisii Central ward candidate was kidnapped by an unidentified group on Wednesday and reportedly beaten up and his posssions stolen by the unidentified group. He was released soon after.
Hundreds of Homa Bay youths held a peaceful demonstration on Wednesday, after learning of the president Uhuru's lead on Raila Odinga.

Five unidentified attackers armed with knives attacked a polling station where elections results were being tallied in Hola town, stabbing one person. Police intervened, shooting dead two of the assailants. The three others escaped.
Three people die in riots/clashes with police the day after polling in Kawangware.
Police fired tear gas and shot dead a man who was trying to separate to rival supporters from fighting outside Nduru Girls' Secondary School, a tallying centre in South Mugirango constituency.
Bonfire at Olympic stage, crowds hold sticks and rocks, burning tires

Tharaka Nithi, supporters of some candidates clashed at Chuka Igambang'ombe constituency tallying centre at Chuka Boys' High over alleged malpractices. Police broke up physical fights between supporters of rival candidates.

Five unidentified attackers armed with knives attacked a polling station where elections results were being tallied in Hola town, stabbing one person. Police intervened, shooting dead two of the assailants. The three others escaped.
Police dispersed youths in Kisumu who were protesting electoral fraud.

9 People are killed in Mathare in the context of electoral protests/riots between 9-13 Aug in Mathare (other fatalities coded elsewhere). Four are killed on the 9th when police are overwhelmed by violent opposition protesters.
Voters at Kuresoi chased the local MP from the polling station.
2 people were killed in Pumwani when voters stampeded.
5 knife-wielding men attacked a polling station in Galole. They killed 1 person, before police opened fire, killing 2 of the attackers.
Suspected Al Shabaab militants hijacked 2 cars carrying voters between Omar Jillo and Lafey.
Police fired into the air to disperse a crowd of rioting voters in Embakasi East.
Police fired gunshots at Likoni polling station to clear citizens who were trying to block their entry.
Voters in Kitui beat up the county official who was attempting to buy votes for his candidate.
5 people were injured when voters stampeded in Mathare.
Voters in Nyeri rioted when the Presiding Officer at the Polling Station attempted to censor the media.
Voters rioted at Roysambu Primary School Polling Station, and were suppressed by the police.
A police officer attempts to assassinate an election officer in Elgeyo on 08 Aug.
Voters in Budalangi rioted and attacked people with ballot papers. The police tried to prevent the crowd from surging.
Police threw teargas and the crowd of voters stampeded at Kariokor, near the mosque in Starehe. 24 people were injured.
Supporters of the ODM and Jubilee candidates in Chonyi, Kilifi, clashed at 3am on voting day. 1 person was killed.
Voters stampeded at a Polling Station in Donholm, near Umoja. Police fired in the air. More than 5 people were injured.
Police officers in Kangemi flogged voters who were not forming straight lines.
Voters rioted in Nyamira when several polling stations had failures. Police suppressed the voters.
Police at Ziwa La Ngombe fired teargas to disperse rioting voters.
More than 300 people camped outside the IEBC offices in Kisumu to protest the fact that they have not been included in the Voters Roll.
Police officers engaged in a shoot out with Al Shabaab, after a landmine injured civilians in Nyorongo
Two people were injured after the vehicle they were travelling in ran over a landmine at Nyongoro along the Garsen-Lamu road.
A Kitui County executive committee member was attacked by voters over allegations of vote buying.
Civil Society groups, organised by the Kenyan Human Rights Commission, held another demonstration protesting the murder of IEBC official, Msando.
Al Shabaab militants destroyed an electricity pylon near Gamba, causing a blackout across Lamu county.
A Kitui County executive committee member was attacked by voters over allegations of vote buying. The executive sustained a serious head wound before being handed over to police.
Youth in Garissa held a march to call for a peaceful election.
Al Shabab forces attacked the village of Damase in Garissa county and seized it fully after brief fighting with Kenyan police officers who fled the area during the fighting.
The ODM MP candidate and his wife were attacked by unidentified political activists while they were campaigning near Rongo, in Kanyamkago. They have been hospitalised.
The supporters of two rival ODM candidates clashed at a rally in Migori. Youth hurled stones at each other. 2 people were injured
Rioters threw stones at an ODM candidate's vehicle as it travelled from Kabunde airstrip, in Homa Bay.
Movement of forces: Nasa tallying centre in Westlands, Nairobi,was raided at night by hooded gunmen - suspected to be police agents - on 4 August.

ODM and Wiper supporters engaged in a shouting match as each group demanded to be addressed by the respective leaders. Youths from the groups climbed of the stage and had to be removed. No reported violence.
After hearing rumours that some candidates are missing from the ballot papers, youths in Embu staged a demonstration.
A Police Officer was killed during an attempted attack by Al-Shabaab at Lafey police station. Some of Al-Shabaab members suffered injuries when police responded wih gunshots. A police car was stolen
Youths stormed the home of the Othaya independent candidate after they heard a rumour that he had been hoarding ballot papers. Police arrested the youths.
A police officer was shot dead by a colleague on Wednesday. Police are investigating the case

Family, relatives and friends of IEBC ICT CEO Chris Msando staged peaceful demonstrations walking for five kilometres from their Lifunga village to Ukwala trading centre, Siaya County, protesting his brutal murder. The protesters asked the government to involve foreign agencies to investigate his murder.
Three people were killed and four injured after a passenger bus was ambushed by Al Shabaab.

Youths aligned to the Jubilee Party Tuesday staged peaceful protests in parts of Kisii Town in defence of acting Interior Cabinet Secretary Fred Matiang'i shortly after Nasa leaders left Gusii Stadium.
Human rights groups marched around Uhuru Park to protest the murder of Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission ICT Manager Chris Msando, and demanded justice for those involved in the murder.
Nakumatt Holdings' workers protest over unpaid salaries along the Mombassa-Nairobi road. Unknown location; Makindu is halfway point.
One attacker was shot and killed, while a police officer was found dead after being taken hostage during a 20-hour siege at the home of Deputy President William Ruto.
Youth in Meru county took to the streets to demonstrate against what they term as poor performance by the county's governor Peter Munya.

actor2: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: A police officer was injured when the home of deputy president was broken into by an unidentified armed group. A police officer used as a human shield is killed while the GSU kill one of the attackers.
Youth in Kibera constituency staged a march to call for a peaceful election.

The bodies of the Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission ICT Manager, Chris Msando, and another youth were found stripped of clothing in a thicket in Kiambu County and were transported to the City Mortuary on Saturday at 11 am by Kikuyu Police Station officers. IEBC denounced the attack as an attack against democracy, considering the victim's role in ensuring credible elections in Kenya.
Al Shabaab militants hijacked a car painted in Jubilee campaign colours in Falana, near Mandera. The driver and a passenger were kidnapped.

assoc_actor_2: IEBC: Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission
notes: The IEBC ICT manager, Chris Msando, disappeared from his office in Nairobi. His body and the body of a woman were found the next day on the outskirts of Nairobi. It is believed that Msando was murdered for political reasons.

A group in ODM t-shirts demonstrated along Oginga Odinga Street. They were then confronted by other ODM supporters who accused the protesters of sabotaging Odinga's election bid. The confronting ODM supporters then burnt the shirts. Kisumu Central ODM Chairman Seth Ochieng who led the group that scuttled the demonstration says as ODM they were not aware of the demonstration.
A meeting organised by Nairobi Women in Nairobi was disrupted by rowdy youth, who stormed the church and broke up the meeting
Supporters of the two candidates in Marsabit threw stones at each other in Marsabit where President Kenyatta was expected to rally on wedsnesday.

assoc_actor_1: NARC: National Rainbow Coalition; Jubilee Coalition
notes: NARC supporters disrupted a Jubilee rally for the Kirinyaga candidate. The police fired into the air to disperse the crowd. One person was seriously injured. The candidate's campaign car was stolen.
Jubilee candidate's bodyguards fired shots in the air to disperse the youth who demanded to be paid after attending a rally. The youth blocked roads, attacked vehicles and injured some passengers.
The home of the political adviser to the governor of Siaya was petrol bombed by unidentified attackers. His car was destroyed. He was rescued by neighbours. No injuries reported.
A police officer shot and injured a woman outside the KICC in Nairobi

Jubilee Party campaigns in Mandera turned chaotic after two rival camps clashed at Moi stadium ahead of a rally led by President Uhuru Kenyatta. The two camps, Jubilee supporters and those from the Economic Freedom Party (EFP), hurled stones at each other.
Two suspected robbers were on Saturday morning killed in Kikuyu, Kiambu County. One of the robbers was lynched by a mob while the other was gunned down by police at Ndumbo-ini.
Pokot bandits suspected to be from Tiaty, Baringo East raided Murkutwo in Marakwet East on Saturday, injuring two herders.
Pokot bandits suspected to be from Tiaty, Baringo East raided Murkutwo in Marakwet East on Saturday, injuring two herders. A similar attack took place at Kaben area, which killed one man.
On 22 July 2017, two suspected robbers killed in Kikuyu, Kiambu County. One of the robbers was lynched by a mob while the other was gunned down by police at Ndumbo-ini. [size=no report]
Three people were shot dead and two others injured during an attack at Bendera village in Baragoi town, Samburu County. An unknown number of cattle were also stolen and driven towards Suguta valley
Five people are injured in a clash between supporters of Mandago and those of Buzeki. The violence is related to an upcoming campaign.
After a violent cattle raid, polie clash with the raiders and recapture the stolen livestock
Al Shabaab kill two civilians while attacking civilians in the Mararani area.

Unknown gunmen on Thursday night shot dead a businessman in Chebukwabi village, Kimilili constituency, in Bungoma County. Robert Barasa, a known campaigner for Bungoma Governor Ken Lusaka, was shot dead by armed men in his home.
Nurses in Kisii again protest over working conditions. They claim the state has sidelined them after doctors and clinical officers received a pay increase
A Baringo chief who went missing on Tuesday was found dead in a bush at Olmoran range in Laikipia county, the following day, shot.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: Police repulse an attack by Al Shabaab on Mokowe GSU camp.

A powerful explosion caused by a land mine, occurred in parts of NFD [Northern Frontier District, Kenya'snortheastern region], targeting Kenyan military forces and resulting in casualties in an area called Abdi Ali in Liboi town.
The car of the ODM governor of Mombasa was attacked by a mob of people. One of the ODM supporters in the car was attacked and kicked by the rioters. As the car drove away it was pelted with stones.

Pokot and Tugen herders clash for several hours in Kapkechir after an attack by the Pokot. The Pokot attackers killed four Tugen herder and stole their cattle. The attack led to a protest in nearby Mochongoi.

Five security officers were killed during an operation to rescue a principal secretary in the ministry of lands and physical planning. A battle between the security personnel and Al Shabaab fighters left five security officers dead
Police officers used tear gas canisters to disperse youths who were throwing stones at a NASA convoy during a rally in Thika.
Three people were killed and several were injured including Public Works Principal Secretary Mariam El Maawy, during an ambush by Al Shabaab attack in Lamu West.

Pokot and Tugen herders clash for several hours in Kapkechir after an attack by the Pokot. The Pokot attackers killed four Tugen herder and stole their cattle. The attack led to a protest in nearby Mochongoi.
NASA leaders were attacked by Jubilee supporters who threw stones at their convoy in Githurai during a NASA rally. Some bodyguards shoot in the air to disperse the youths before driving off.
Rowdy youth disrupted Kenyatta's rally in Kisumu.
Nurses in Kissi chanted songs, waved placards and staged a mock burial for Council of Governors Chairman and Salaries and Remuneration Commission (SRC) in protest at low salaries.

Jared Ratemo, a lawyer attached to the Kenya Revenue Authority, was found killed on Mombassa road on the morning of 12/07. The date of death may have been the previous day, as it was then he went missing. He may have been killed because of some sensitive investigations he was carrying out at KRA.
Rowdy youth disrupted the NASA rally in Kabarnet, Baringo.
Kenyatta and Ruto arrived in Mbita for a Jubilee rally, but were disrupted by youths chanting NASA songs. The youths chased them away from the rally.
Pokot raiders attacked herdsmen who were repairing an electric fence at Laikipia Natre Conservancy
Six police officers have been killed, while four have been injured, during a shootout with Pokot bandits who ambushed them at a ranch in Kamwenje area.
After Pokot raiders kill four, one bandit was shot by police
Two herdsmen and a suspected bandit were killed in a shootout that lasted for more than an hour in Kapkechir village in Baringo.

A Jubilee candidate running for Kirimari Ward seat in Embu County was admitted to hospital when he fell unconscious minutes after he was hit with a microphone by a supporter of his rival. This was after a group of about 10 people, carrying posters of the rival candidate shouted at the Jubilee candidate .
The police have launched air strikes in Boni Forest to attack Al Shabaab fighters
About 1,000 people were displaced in Igembe Central, 13 people killed and three people injured following clashes along the Meru-Isiolo boundary on Monday.
A man from Isiolo was attacked by a mob at a market near Maua. The police intervened, but he died shortly afterwards.
Meru inhabitants stabbed 3 Isiolo inhabitants to death at Kiutine market as part of the ongoing Meru-Isiolo border conflict.
Property destruction: Houses were burned in villages on the Isiolo-Meru border as part of an ongoing border conflict between the counties.
In retaliation for the killing of a herder the previous day, a group of herders killed 2 men.
In Tigania East a herdsman was attacked and killed by cattle rustlers.

At least nine people were killed in Lamu County on Saturday morning, in an attack by Al Shabaab. The attack occurred at Jima and Pandaguo villages near the border with Somalia. At Jima, Al Shabaab beheaded four men (coded in other event).
Four men have been beheaded by Al Shabaab at Jima area bordering Pandanguo in Lamu county. Kenya Standard reports 9 people were beheaded and the event took place on the previous day.
Movement of forces: On 5 July, the government deployed troops to Lamu to look for al-Shabab who have been attacking civilians and police officers in the county.
At least nine people were killed in Lamu County on Saturday morning, in an attack by Al Shabaab. The attack occurred at Jima and Pandaguo village near the border with Somalia
4 Meru youths were attacked and killed by Isiolo inhabitants as they transported milk on the Maua-Garbayulla road as part of the ongoing Isiolo-Meru border conflict.
Residents in Karatina town, marched in the streets protesting the disqualification of Mr Mathenge candidacy to run for the elections

Residents waving placrads, twigs and blowed vuvuzelas stormed the IEBC offices in Nyeiry Town demanding an audience with the county elections manager. Armed administration officers blocked them from accessing the offices.
Property destruction: suspected ODM supporters vandalised and damaged the campaign truck of the Jubilee candidate, Hassan Omar.

At least three police officers and one Al shabaab member were killed after Al Shabaab raided Pandanguo Police Camp in Lamu. Al Shabaab engaged in a gun battle with the police that lasted for hours. One police officer was unaccounted for. Al Shabaab planted IEDs while raiding the station. Government troops were later deployed to Lamu to look for al-Shabab. The Kenya Standard claims 2 police dead in the attack.
There was a gunfight between cattle-raiding militants and police officers. The shots disrupted a political rally at Karumaindo shopping centre as the residents fled.
Hundreds of Uchumi Supermarket workers took to the streets to protest non-payment of their salaries since May.
Hundreds of supporters of Governor Nathif Jama on Tuesday poured to the streets over reports that his Sh5.2 billion bank account has been frozen.

Herders in Bambo, Mandera, have discovered five bodies buried in a shallow grave.The five, four men and a woman, were reported missing by their relatives last week.The locals exhumed the bodies on Monday [3 July] morning and took them to Lafey Hospital.Medical personnel at the hospital told Nation.co.ke that a male body had bullet wounds in the forehead and the other bodies appeared to have been strangled.The five were from Fino Ward but their bodies were found in Warankara Ward about 65 kilometres away.

University workers go on strike and demonstrate at the main campuses of University of Nairobi, Maasai Mara University, Jomo Kenyatta University of Science at Technology in Juja, Technical University of Mombasa, Kisii University among others. The strike was over the perceived failure to implement a pact signed with the government in March which involved a pay rise for Kenya University Staff Union (Kusu) members.

University workers go on strike and demonstrate at the main campuses of University of Nairobi, Maasai Mara University, Jomo Kenyatta University of Science at Technology in Juja, Technical University of Mombasa, Kisii University among others. The strike was over the perceived failure to implement a pact signed with the government in March which involved a pay rise for Kenya University Staff Union (Kusu) members.

University workers go on strike and demonstrate at the main campuses of University of Nairobi, Maasai Mara University, Jomo Kenyatta University of Science at Technology in Juja, Technical University of Mombasa, Kisii University among others. The strike was over the perceived failure to implement a pact signed with the government in March which involved a pay rise for Kenya University Staff Union (Kusu) members.

University workers go on strike and demonstrate at the main campuses of University of Nairobi, Maasai Mara University, Jomo Kenyatta University of Science at Technology in Juja, Technical University of Mombasa, Kisii University among others. The strike was over the perceived failure to implement a pact signed with the government in March which involved a pay rise for Kenya University Staff Union (Kusu) members.

University workers go on strike and demonstrate at the main campuses of University of Nairobi, Maasai Mara University, Jomo Kenyatta University of Science at Technology in Juja, Technical University of Mombasa, Kisii University among others. The strike was over the perceived failure to implement a pact signed with the government in March which involved a pay rise for Kenya University Staff Union (Kusu) members.
Residents pelted a police vehicle with stones and barricaded the Mombasa-Malindi road in Kilifi town following the shooting of a man by a prison warder.
Residents of Utalii in Mathare rioted and burned tires to protest against the repeating of ODM nominations.
The police shot into the air to disperse a crowd of rioting youths at a political rally in Meru.

Herders in Bambo, Mandera, have discovered five bodies buried in a shallow grave.The locals exhumed the bodies on Monday [3 July] morning and took them to Lafey Hospital.Medical personnel at the hospital told Nation.co.ke that a male body had bullet wounds in the forehead and the other bodies appeared to have been strangled.The five were from Fino Ward but their bodies were found in Warankara Ward about 65 kilometres away.

Youths injured an NTV cameraman and stoned vehicles after a rally addressed by Nasa leader Raila Odinga in Migori town ended. At least 10 vehicles were pelted with stones, including one belonging to the Nation Media Group. The youths barricaded the road at Posta roundabout and attacked motorists on the highway. Police used teargas to disperse them.
Police arrested 27 youths armed with crude weapons, who were planning to disrupt a NASA rally in Nyando.

Arrests: Police have arrested 27 armed youth said to have been planning to disrupt a political rally in Rabuor, Kisumu County. Several crude weapons, including three machetes and two knives, and two rolls of bhang were found.
The Kenyan security forces rescued 2 of the 4 pupils kidnapped during the Al Shabaab attack on Kiunga two days previously. No reports of clashes.
Youths suspected to be part of the outlawed Mungiki militia kill a butcher and torch houses in Embakasi. The attack was believed to be over a land dispute.
Residents of Handege shopping centre in Gatundu South, protested and blocked the Gatundu-Karinga -Flyover road demanding that speed bumps be erected.

Eight people including four school children and four police officers were killed in a roadside bomb attack planted by suspected Al Shabaab fighters that occurred in Kiunga, Lamu on Tuesday. The police officers were escorting the school children to Kiunga from Mararani, when the lorry was hit by an IED. Following the blast, al Shabaab opened fire on the victims.

assoc_actor_1: NASA: National Super Alliance; ODM: Orange Democratic Movement
notes: ODM and NASA youths rioted at Raila Odinga's rally in Rarieda. The police dispersed the crowd with teargas.

Residents in Tharaka-Nithi County set up road blocks on the Meru-Nairobi highway demanding that speed bumps be built after a boy was knocked down by a lorry on Monday. Police were deployed in the area to disperse the crowd

The county commander said several people have been arrested in connection with an attack on a lorry carrying camels along Laisamis Road. One person was killed. The attackers transferred the animals to another truck and drove off.

A 12 year old boy was beheaded by raiders on Sunday morning in Saku constituency. Another person was seriously injured during the attack. The attack is suspected to be linked to recent violence between the Rendille and Borana communities.
Youth in Meru lit born fires and barricaded the Meru-Embu highway in protest over the construction of a road. Anti-riot police dispersed the crowd by using teargas.
A secondary school student was shot dead by suspected Pokot cattle rustlers in Kaben, Marakwet East at 8am.
Jubilee and KANU supporters clashed during a rally led by Uasin Gishu Governor Jackson Mandago in Kabarnet, Baringo on Saturday.
Police officers exchanged fire with Al Shabaab after they attacked the Equity Back in Elwak Town. Five police reported dead.
An Improvised Device (IED) exploded when a vehicle ran over it. The vehicle was heading to Mandera from Elwak. No one was injured in the attack.
A group of elderly women from Ngangarithi held a protest against grabbing of a wetland by private developers.
Five people were killed when Al Shabaab attacked the Equity bank In Elwak Town.
200 survivors of the 2008 election violence in Kiambaa gathered to call on politicians to avoid hate speech in the election campaign.
Police were forced to fire gunshots in the air after youth took advantage of the crowds to steal from those gathered to hear Kenneth speak.
One criminal was shot dead by police officers at Hongera in Kisauni, Mombasa County.
Two suspected criminals were killed in Mishomoroni by a mob.
An Administration Police officer shot dead two of his colleagues in Baringo County, in unclear circumstances.

Residents protest over preparations for Uhuru visit to Murang'a. They blocked roads leading to the town on Tuesday morning and demanded to have the road reconstructed. Police intervened to stop the protest
Arrests: Police have arrested more than 80 people suspected to be 'terrorists' in Eastleigh.

Students from Kirimon Primary School in Samburu West Sub County attacked and injured three female teachers in protest against being punished by female teachers. The school was closed after the attack.
Nine Kenyan soldiers were killed, and ten others were injured when a road side bomb explosed. Al Shabaab confirmed claimed responsibility of the attack.

Students from Kirimon Primary School in Samburu West Sub County attacked and injured three female teachers in protest against being punished by female teachers. The school was closed after the attack. Police are injured when they try to rescue the besieged teachers.
One person has been killed and about 500 cattle stolen by suspected bandits along the West Pokot-Turkana border. Thsi is believed to be part of a dispute between Pokot and Turkana communities.
Residents of Muhoroni took to the streets to protest against the candidature of former MP Ayiecho Olweny.
NASA and Jubilee supporters clashed and threw stones at each other during Odinga's rally in Mutuati, in Meru.
Four cilivilians killed and 11 injured when a passenger bus struck a roadside bomb suspected to have been planted by Al Shabaab between Lafey and Elwak in Madera county.
Youth in Kitui were injured in a riot for cash thrown by politicians at a rally.
Students barricaded Jogoo road, protesting the bus driver who injured a volunteer who helped them crossed the road. They demanded the government to erect bumps on the road to improve road safety.
A Boda Boda rider was killed by unidentified assailants over the management of campaign money for a local politician.

Kanu and Jubilee supporters have clashed in Makutano town in Kapenguria, West Pokot ahead of President Uhuru Kenyatta's visit later today. One person has been injured and rushed to hospital. Police intervened to disperse the crowd.

A police officer is admitted Nyahururu hospital after he was shot by herders during a security operation to remove illegal herders from the Laikipia Nature Conservancy. The herders and police engaged in a gun battle.
Supporters of an independent candidate rioted in Iten prior to the arrival of Kenyatta for a political rally.
In Marakwet East, a man was shot dead on Tuesday afternoon by suspected Pokot bandits.
Nurses, striking for two weeks, hold a protest in Nairobi.
Nurses, striking for two weeks, hold a protest in Kisumu.
Political parties clashed in Thika. 1 person was injured.
A NASA senatorial aspirant is attacked by a crowd and deeply cut by a machete.
Detonation: The IED planted by Al Shabaab, and targeting Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) along the Milimani-Baure's supply route detonated without any casualties or injuries on the side of KDF.
A KDF convoy was transporting military supplies to Somalia when it was targeted in a massive roadside explosion, just outside of Liboi town. Several soldiers wounded.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: A member of the GSU is non-fatally shot by 'bandits'.
Youths tried to attack Nyando MP Fred Outa at a funeral on Saturday.Some of the locals started heckling speakers, demanding that Governor Jack Ranguma addresses the ceremony in Ahero.
Six people were killed and several others injured after armed Pokot bandits attacked Lokori in Turkana South on Saturday.

Two people were killed and three others injured after about 200 armed bandits attacked Kamuge village in Turkana East. The bandits are said to be from Baringo East. Police reservists responded and exchange of fire with the bandits.
Matatu operators blocked sections of Moi Avenue in protest of officers demanding money from them everyday.The protests caused traffic until the police dispersed the protests

Raiders from Isiolo attacked an Administration Police (AP) camp at Mlango, about 30 kilometres from Isiolo Town. At the same time, five people were shot dead during a battle between police and armed communal militia at Mlango in Burat Ward, Isiolo County, who had stolen cattle. The militiamen were believed to be from Isolio and Samburu counties.
'Rogue' bus conductors block Tom Mboya street in protest of an unknown issue.
A journalist was attacked by a politician's bodyguards.

At least three people were killed after a car they were travelling in hit a landmine along Dadaab-Kulan road in Garissa County [eastern Kenya]. Al Shabaab believed responsible. One person escaped with injuries. The Star reports four dead.
Nurses protested at the County Referral Hospital in Voi. Wards remained deserted as patients were collected by relatives.
The inhabitants of Eldama Ravine attacked 2 teenage boys and a man who they accused of stealing cattle. One of the boys was lynched and the others were severely injured.

Unknown gunmen shot dead one person and injured another in Mandera country near the Somalia border. The attackers targeted the vehicle belonging to a local political aspirant Mohamed Abdi who was not in the convoy of the two cars headed to El Wak town.
On Monday, a team of security officers escaped an IED explosion unhurt as they hunted down a group of al-Shabab militants who had planted landmines in Gerille area, Wajir County.

NASA [National Super Alliance] supporters burnt Jubilee campaign materials in Kisii town on Monday [5 June]. They temporarily blocked the road outside the Capital Hotel roundabout as they burnt the posters on the road.
Nurses in Kisii hold demonstrations to protest failure by the national and county governments to honour CBA
Jubilee and NASA supporters clashed at a rally in Kapsabet.
Dissenting supporters of the Jubilee coalition protested against President Uhuru Kenyatta and his deputy William Ruto over their interference in local intra-Jubilee electoral contests
President Kenyatta's convoy faced protests by youth supporting independent candidates in Karatina, Othaya and Nyeri towns.

One person was killed and several others injured on Friday in clashes between rival political groups in Bungoma county in Western Kenya. The two groups engaged in violent confrontations after their candidates were cleared by the Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission (IEBC) to contest in the Aug. 8 general elections. Police fired teargas to disperse them.
Silent protests against Kenyatta and Ruto over the results of the primaries. In Laikipia, hundreds of residents carried the banners of independent Nderitu Mureithi.
President Kenyatta's convoy faced protests by youth supporting independent candidates in Karatina, Othaya and Nyeri towns
Silent protests against Kenyatta and Ruto over the results of the Jubilee primaries. In Ol Kalou in Nyandarua County, hundreds of residents carried Wanjiku Muhia's banners.
President Kenyatta's convoy faced protests by youth supporting independent candidates in Karatina, Othaya and Nyeri towns
Al-Shabaab militants burned down a school and abducted two teachers in an overnight attack in Fafi, Garissa. One teacher is killed.

Two soldiers from Kenya Defence forces were killed, and another wounded in an IED explosion. Al-Shabaab claimed responibility of the attack. Another IED exploded in the same area on the same day before a Kenyan vehicle passed, leaving the passengers unharmed.
Seven police officers and a civilian were killed when an armoured vehicle drove over a roadside bomb in southeastern Kenya. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility
An explosive device aimed at a military lorry went off between Kiunga and Ishakani. It exploded early and there were no casualties.
Two motorists were shot and severely injured during a demonstration against police officers in Moyale town.

Lamu residents demonstrated in Malindi on 30/05/2017 against a court case regarding a wind energy project in Baharini in Mpeketoni, Lamu. They called for a withdrawal of a case on land set aside for the project and protesting against the delays that the court case will cause to the project. No fatalities nor injuries are reported.
ANC party representative's supporters protested against the Independent Electoral Commission (IEBC) after the candidate's name was missing from the IEBC register list.

Students of the Laikipia University (the main campus is located 11km from Nyahururu) protested against the rise in student fees on 29/05/2017. As Vice Chancelor (VC) refused to meet the protesting students, the students started to throw stones and took the streets. VC called the police to disperse them. No fatalities reported.
Three suspected Al-Shaabab militants were killed in a gun battle with police in Tana River County on Monday.
Supporters of NASA and Jubilee threw stones at each other outside Kenyatta International Conference Centre (KICC) as President Uhuru Kenyatta presented his papers to the electoral body for clearance.

1 student was killed and scores of students were injured when a fire broke out at a school in Bondo. The fire is believed to be linked to election-based protests that had broken out in the school some weeks previously.
Three rangers were shot dead and five others seriously injured by Moran local fighters on Sunday
A man was shot dead by a gang in Mai Mahiu on 26/05/2017. The police has yet to establish the motive of the killing.
Three Al-Shabaab militants shot dead a Tana River County Assembly driver on Friday

Herders from Isiolo and Marsabit are feared dead as they engaged each other in a deadly gun battle throughout Friday. Residents from the two sides said the herders exchanged fire that led to deaths estimated to be over 10 people. Both sides had casualties, but the Isiolo side reportedly lost more men.
Violence broke out as hundreds of K'Oyoo's supporters, lit twigs and blocked roads to protest the absence of his name as a candidate on the Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission (IEBC)s.
Youth in Oyugis rioted at the campaign rally of the Homa Bay governor. The police dispersed the crowd with teargas.

Two people were injured after supporters of Tharaka-Nithi Governor Samuel Ragwa and Chuka/Igambang'ombe MP Muthomi Njuki clashed at Marimanti town. The group supporting MP Muthomi marched on the highway waving placards against Governor Ragwa. The group supporting Mr Ragwa ran after the other group hurling stones.

At last five police officers were killed and one other injured after an Improvised Explosive Devise tore their vehicle along the Malelei-Kulan Road in Liboi, Garissa County. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attacks
3 rangers were killed in a battle with Moran cattle raiders in Archers Post.
Women protest demanding a man accused of sodomising local children be convicted and jailed.
Property destruction: Over 100 camels have been killed and at least 47 houses torched by bandits who locals believe are security officers on the border of Kitui and Tana River counties.
On 24 May, two police officers were killed in an explosion between Malelei and Kulan in Garissa, near Hagadera refugee camp
At least three policemen were killed in an IED explosions in Liboi, Garissa County, near the Kenya - Somalia border. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attacks.

At least five policemen were killed in an IED explosions in Mandera, near the Kenya - Somalia border. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attacks. Police later arrested several Al-Shabaab suspects behind the attacks in Mandera county. One of the susptect is a high ranking Al-Shabaab explosives expert

Traders protested demolition of their stalls in Mombasa on 23/05/2017. They barricaded a road with logs and bonfires. The anti-riot team of the Kenyan police forces used tear gas to disperse the demonstrators. No fatalities.
Presiding Officers (POs) and clerks who oversaw Jubilee party's primaries took to the streets of Kericho town to protest the party's bureaucracy and delays in paying them their salaries.

Supporters of Gilgil MP Mathenge Ndiritu blocked access on the Nairobi-Nakuru highway as they were protesting over the outcome of the recent Jubilee primaries.They accused Jubilee of imposing a leader on them after Ndiritu's rival, Martha Wangari, was declared the winner. Riot police intervened and cleared the protest.

Land invaders suspected to be from Baringo County attacked residents on 23 May at Rubere in Laikipia West. The 'bandits' paralysed a security meeting by shooting in the air, dispersing the residents and security officers. Several residents were injured as they scampered for safety.
Angry villagers in Korando, Kisumu West, rioted when police tried to exhume the body of a man involved in a land dispute.
Striking nurses protest in Nyeri town on May 22, 2017
Hundreds of coffee farmers in Embu County held demonstrations at Manyatta market, protesting delays in paying their salaries.

assoc_actor_1: Jubilee Coalition; PDR: Party of Development and Reforms
notes: Supporters of Isiolo Governor Godana Doyo (Party for Development and Reforms - PDR), Senator Mohammed Kuti (Independent) and Abdul Bahari (Jubilee) hurled stones at each other ahead of President Uhuru Kenyatta's political rally. A Jubilee supporter was shot dead by the police when a Jubilee rally in Isiolo turned violent.
Dr Thuo Mathenge and his supporters protest outside Jubilee Party headquarters in Pangani on April 19, 2017 over the outcome of Nyeri governorship nomination.
Supporters of Murang'a governorship aspirant Mwangi wa Iria protest outside Milimani Law Courts in Nairobi on May 19, 2017

assoc_actor_2: FORD-Kenya: Forum for the Restoration of Democracy-Kenya
notes: In Bungoma, a campaigner of governor challenger Wycliffe Wangamati was seriously injured in an attack in Webuye. Mr Joseph Kubende was driving to his home on Friday night when his car was blocked by a Probox whose occupants pulled him out and hit him with a blunt object on the head.

Scores of residents took to the streets in support of area Jubilee gubernatorial candidate, Anne Waiguru, from claims that she was involved in the NYS scandal. The residents, who held a peaceful demonstration in Kutus town, accused MPs who want Waiguru barred from vying for the seat in August of having a sinister agenda. Led by the county Jubilee interim committee treasurer, Rose Njeru, the protestors warned that they would disrupt polls in the county if Waiguru was barred.

Residents blocked Churo-Loruk road to register their disappointment with the police after Churo Amaiya MCA Thomas Minito was found dead on 19 May 2017. Residents armed with crude weapons kicked out journalists who had visited MCA Minito's home, accusing the media of not vibrantly publishing issues that affect the Pokot community such as insecurity and killings of leaders and civilians. They also torched a neighbour's house while protesting the death of MCA Thomas Munito.

The Churo/Amaya ward MCA, Thomas Minito, was reportedly approached by three people at a hotel in Kabarnet town on Tuesday afternoon when he was having lunch with a government official from Tiaty. His body was on Thursday evening found floating in River Athi just under the Donyo Sabuk bridge in Machakos County Reports indicate that the body was retrieved and a small poster found in his coat pocket bearing his name.
Ward representatives in Turkana, who were angry about the dispersal of funds, rioted and locked the civil servants out of the Turkana government offices.

One person has been shot dead in Kerio Valley by cattle rustlers. The rustlers also stole over 40 goats and cattle during the Thursday afternoon attack.They also killed two goats. Elgeyo Marakwet Police Commander Tom Odera said efforts to apprehend the culprits are ongoing.

Chaos has rocked Kaboto market after Tharaka-Nithi and Meru leaders clashed over the border between the two counties. Police officers opened fire to disperse Tharaka residents who accompanied.The angry residents pelted the officers with rocks, smashing the windscreens of several vehicles.
Riots in Tharaka-Nithi lead to Tigania West deputy county commissioner Alfred Makau getting hit by a stone

The Kenya County Government Workers Union recalled all their Nairobi members from their work station on Wednesday morning to hold a protest march at City Hall. The workers are protesting over unpaid April salaries, although the county government received Sh1.021 billion from National Treasury on Tuesday to pay off the salaries.

A Kenyan official was killed on Wednesday after a vehicle he was traveling in ran over an improvised explosive device in Elwak area near Kenya-Somalia border. Mandera East divisional police commander Timothy Muasya said the explosive device was buried on the ground by unknown people. The driver survived with serious injuries after the 1 p.m. incident. Police have blamed the attacks on Al-Shabaab militants who are operating in the area.
In Homa Bay County, two youths were seriously injured in Kendu Bay town after supporters of governor Cyprian Awiti and those of Kasipul MP Oyugi Magwanga clashed. Four youths were arrested.

Kakamega journalists held a peaceful demonstration over increasing attacks and threats against them from police and politicians. They demonstrated along the busy Kakamega-Mumias Road from Shianda market to Mumias East Sub-County offices and presented a petition to Deputy County Commissioner Willy Cheboi.

Nation correspondent Shaban Makokha was assaulted by administration police officers at Shianda Trading Centre while photographing youths fighting over money given to them by a politician. The journalist was treated at St Mary's Mission Hospital in Mumias and discharged.
At least four people died on Tuesday when their vehicle set off an improvised explosive device in a small Kenyan town near the border with Somalia, police said.Al-Shabaab militants were suspected

A security operation is underway in Mandera town [northeastern Kenya] after a chief said to be instrumental in the war against terror was gunned down by people believed to be al-Shabab militia. The heavily armed al-Shabab militants are said to have raided the home of the chief in Omar Jillo location, Lafey sub-county in Mandera East before killing him on the spot. The military and the police have teamed up in an operation to comb Mandera in search of the assailants

There was drama on Mbagathi Road Monday when pupils from Kenyatta Golf Course Academy blocked the highway to protest demolition of their school.The pupils placed their desks across the road and sat on them, blocking traffic in the morning rush hour before they voluntarily moved away to give way to motorists.They demonstrated outside the school with their parents who expressed frustration as they had already paid fees.

Angry youth on Monday blocked the busy Nairobi-Mombasa highway at Caltex area in Voi, Taita Taveta County protesting against unemployment at the Standard Gauge Railway Site at Kasarani area. They burnt tires along the highway. Police intervened to disperse them and arrested seven. The demonstration halted traffic flow along the busy highway forcing motorists delay their journey for hours.
Property destruction: Al Shabaab militants destroyed a communications mast in Wajir
The local MCA was abducted by unidentified attackers. The police did not file a report. His body was found five days later.

An Orange Democratic Movement (ODM) party director of communications Philip Etale was attacked with pepper spray by an unknown group in Nairobi's city centre. He was rushed to Nairobi hospital, where he was treated and discharged later
Suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked a village in Mandera and killed a chief before abducting two police reservists on Monday night.

Two more people have been killed in fresh attacks by bandits at Kasiluni in Kitui County [eastern Kenya], a week after a similar attack in the same area. The two were ambushed separately and shot in their farms on Sunday [14 May] in the volatile area, which borders Mwingi Game Reserve, bringing the number of people killed in the last week to four.

Member of County Assembly aspirant's three sons were found dead. The second was discovered on Wednesday, retrieved the same day and taken to the same hospital mortuary in the evening. The third was found on 18/05. The trio were missing since at least 14/05, when they failed to arrive at a church service. The children's disappearance may be related to politics.
Youths at an ODM meeting in Kakamega assaulted Nation journalist Linet Wafula and destroyed her phone. No serious injuries reported.

residents of Kinangop protest against the issuance of Jubilee Certificate to incumbent Wanjiku Muhia who had allegedly lost to Faith Gitau during Women Rep nominations. The protesters engage in running battles with police.
residents of Engineer protest against the issuance of Jubilee Certificate to incumbent Wanjiku Muhia who had allegedly lost to Faith Gitau during Women Rep nominations.

Heavily-armed al-Shabab mujahideen movement forces have launched a major attack on a village on the outskirts of the city of Garissa [northeast Kenya].Reports from the Somali-dominated NFD [Northern Frontier Districts] of Kenya say the attack caused heavy casualties.Kenyan government officials have not officially commented on the death toll from the attack. Sources say al-Shabab forces seized control of the village, known as Amuma, with Kenyan police officials also confirming the attack to the media.

Supporters of Governor Isaac Rutto (CCM) and National Assembly Deputy Speaker Joyce Laboso (Jubilee) clashed at the funeral in Olbutyo on 13/05/2017. The source does not report any fatalities but one man was seriously injured.

Youth in Mumias on Saturday afternoon took to the streets burning Jubilee T-shirts and other campaign material while chanting pro-Nasa slogans moments after Deputy President William Ruto toured the region.The protests came a few minutes after Mr Ruto had finished addressing hundreds of residents in Bomani in Mumias. The rowdy youth, who went about harassing anyone wearing Jubilee regalia, termed the region a Nasa zone.The demonstrators blamed the Jubilee government for the high cost of living and the woes facing Mumias Sugar Company.
Police use live bullets against rioters barricading the road in the Fly Over area (Ruai) in the outskirts of Nairobi. A person is killed in the cross fire.
residents of Ndarangwa protest against the issuance of Jubilee Certificate to incumbent Wanjiku Muhia who had allegedly lost to Faith Gitau during Women Rep nominations.
residents of Ol Kalou protest against the issuance of Jubilee Certificate to incumbent Wanjiku Muhia who had allegedly lost to Faith Gitau during Women Rep nominations.
residents of Miharati protest against the issuance of Jubilee Certificate to incumbent Wanjiku Muhia who had allegedly lost to Faith Gitau during Women Rep nominations.

One person was shot dead and another injured during protests in Nyandarua town on Saturday evening. Anti-riot police were forced to fire in the air to disperse the residents who accused the Judiciary of overturning the will of the people.The residents were protesting the issuance of Jubilee Certificate to incumbent Wanjiku Muhia who had allegedly lost to Faith Gitau during Women Rep nominations.

Aspiring Woman Representative Esther Passaris (ODM) was held hostage for several hours by 'goons' at University of Nairobi. The attackers were known to be led by a student who was a member of the local County Assembly (political affiliation not known) and demanded a large amount of money for release. The attackers were said to have attacked the candidate, her bodyguards and threatened to burn cars. The leader of the attackers was later arrested and the candidate was freed.

University students from around the country protested against the employment policy of the Standard Gauge Railway construction in Voi on 12/05/2017. They blocked the Nairobi-Mombasa highway, accusing the China Roads and Bridges Company of employing foreigners, even though the President had ordered the company employ locals. Seven youth were arrested by the police, because of blocking the highway. No fatalities.
Two quarry workers were shot dead Friday and one was missing in a suspected extremist attack in Kenya's northern county of Mandera, a government official said.
Riots in Nakuru over an unspecified issue
Unidentified people wielding machetes destroyed a candidate's billboard.
Two people are shot and killed by raids on their farms by unidentified communal gunmen

Al Shabaab militants raided Omar Jilo, in northern Kenya, where they clashed with police forces. 2 local administrators were killed and 2 police reservists were abducted. Security personnel are pursuing the attackers.

Residents of Aguthi Gaki ward in Tetu constituency, Nyeri County, destroyed water pipes as they demonstrated against an irrigation project in the neighbouring Mathira constituency.The residents say they will not benefit from the project though the pipes pass through their ward.Led by Tetu Jubilee parliamentary aspirant Mwangi Gichuhi, the residents uprooted the pipes and said no work will proceed until an agreement between the two constituencies is honoured.

Medical interns posted in government hospitals across the country have protested against the reversal without explanation of salaries that were paid into their bank accounts 'last week.' (Source dated 16/05) At least 335 out of a total 725 interns posted in different State hospitals are pointing fingers at their employer, the Ministry of Health, for the confusion.

assoc_actor_1: KNUT: Kenya National Union of Teachers
notes: Teachers took to the streets of Iten town to protest an alleged grabbing of 100 acres of land belonging to Prime Time Sacco (PTS), formerly Keiyo Teachers Sacco (KTS). The protest brought teachers from Keiyo and Marakwet with unions from two Sub-Counties meeting in Iten town to fight for their rights in the Eldoret land valued at Sh3 billion. Led by Keiyo Kenya National Union of Teachers (KNUT) Executive Secretary, Musa Busienei, the teachers said they legally purchased the land from National Social Security Fund in 2004 but Kenya Prisons and MTRH later laid claim to the same land.

Cattle rustlers attacked the village of Seretion on 09/05/2017, recovering goats that had been stolen three days earlier. A police reservist and a suspected robber were killed in the shootout. Hundreds of locals are fleeing now to safer places, as similar attacks have taken place in the region recently.

Further reports have emerged of the damage caused by an explosion that targeted a Kenyan army convoy in Garissa County, northeastern Kenya. The explosion which was a land mine attack was targeted on a Kenya army convoy in between Liboi town and Kulan village in Garissa county. Kenyan police said the explosion injured several soldiers with three sustaining serious injuries. The injured were airlifted to a hospital in the capital, Nairobi, for treatment. No one who has claimed responsibility for the attack given that al-Shabab has severally taken credit for attacks that have happened in northeastern Kenya.

A boda boda rider has died Tuesday morning after a collision with a KDF truck in Isiolo Town.There was tension as angry locals threatened to set a blaze the truck.They were also threatening to lynch the driver of the lorry.Police officers had to shoot in the air to disperse the crowd and allow them to collect the body of the boda boda rider.Two other people were seriously injured in the crash and were rushed to the Isiolo County Referral Hospital.

Njiru residents held demonstration early today in protest of a hit and run accident.The residents claim a young man was last night hit by a driver who did not bother to stop the car or take the man to the hospital.The angry demonstrates blocked the road bringing all activities in the area to a standstill.

At least six Kenyan security officers were injured in a bomb blast on Monday in the northeast region of Garissa near the Somali border. Somali militant group Al-Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack, saying its fighters killed four government soldiers, including two commanders.
Dan Ocholla, a journalist at The Standard, was attacked and seriously injured by Kakamega County soldiers while taking photos of injured workers at a construction site in the town.
Ngecha residents demonstrated on 07/05/2017 urging the government to prevent crime in the area. The demonstration was sparked by recent murders.
On May 7, Mr Bernard Otieno, 43, was seriously injured after he was attacked at Chemelil market where supporters of Masogo/Nyangoma MCA Samuel Ong'ow and his rival Habil Nyasuna clashed.

Cattle rustlers raided the village of Ngaratuko on 06/05/2017. They shot dead two people and stole goats. Due to the recent attacks, many schools are closed and hundreds of locals are fleeing now to safer places.
Presiding officers and clerks hired by Jubilee Party during the Nakuru County nominations on Friday staged a demonstration to demand for their pay at the party regional headquarters in Milimani.

Demonstrations erupted in Eldoret after it emerged that Jubilee was planning to repeat the primaries at the station. Unknown people attacked three Governor Jackson Mandago's campaigners (Jubilee Party). No fatalities.

Doctors protest over unpaid salaries. Medical interns posted in government hospitals across the country have protested against the reversal without explanation of salaries that were paid into their bank accounts 'last week.' (Source dated 16/05) At least 335 out of a total 725 interns posted in different State hospitals are pointing fingers at their employer, the Ministry of Health, for the confusion.

In Kondele, Kisumu town, residents of Migosi ward protested against the issuance of a certificate to Pamela Oyoo instead of Victor Rodgers. They lit bonfires and demanded that Rodgers be given the certificate or they would boycott the August polls. They accused ODM board secretary Bob Arunga of rigging out Rodgers.

In Nyando subcounty, residents of Ahero ward took to the streets from 6am, protesting against the issuing of a certificate to Amos Odote. Residents questioned the criteria that the National Elections Board used to award the certificate. They blocked the Ahero-Awasi road and lit bonfires before they stormed the ODM party office and set furniture on fire. They painted the office with Jubilee Party colours and wrote 'Jubilee Party, Uhuru Tena'.

Residents of Molo protest for two days after a rumour that the losing Jubilee candidate was handed the ticket after lodging a complaint to the central party tribunal. The protests were conducted 'last week', source dated 13/05. They blocked the busy Nakuru Eldoret highway causing a traffic snarl for over four hours forcing police to lobe teargas canisters in order to disperse them.

Looting: Cattle rustlers attacked the village of Chemorongion in April or early May 2017 (the source does not incidate an exact date). The source does not indicate any fatalities or injuries. 300 livestock were stolen.
Demonstrations were in most of the major towns in Nyandarua on Thursday afternoon following claims a woman representative hopeful rigged nominations.
Al Shabaab militants attacked El Wak town. 2 people were killed.

Residents of Molo protest for two days after a rumour that the losing Jubilee candidate was handed the ticket after lodging a complaint to the central party tribunal. The protests were conducted 'last week', source dated 13/05. They blocked the busy Nakuru Eldoret highway causing a traffic snarl for over four hours forcing police to lobe teargas canisters in order to disperse them.
The announcement that Prof Nyong'o had trounced Governor Jack resulted in protests in an unspecified location.
Supporters of candidates who had lost the Jubilee primaries thronged outside the Jubilee headquarters to protest for their candidates.
A suspected car thief is attacked and injured by a vigilante mob.
ODM youths protested in Langata when the primary results were announced.

Transport in Busia Town was disrupted for more than one hour Monday as matatu operators held a demonstration to protest the deplorable condition of the main bus park and roads.The protesters planted banana tubers in numerous potholes around the park and nearby roads.Traders also joined the protest, saying they have been losing customers because the roads are rendered impassable when it rains.
The crowd at a Kilimani polling centre attacked a woman who was believed to have been bribing voters during the ODM primaries, though no reports of injuries sustained.
ODM youths forced their way into the Ziwani Hall during the primaries in Nairobi. The police forced them out and locked the gates.
Residents of Mairo Inya township in Ndaragwa protest along the streets against alleged rigging out of Ndaragwa MP Waweru Ndiritu
Youth in Naivasha protested the incumbent governor's defeat in the primaries.
Gunmen killed five civilians from Pokot and injured another 3 at Kapedo trading centre. This is believed to be a revenge attack.
Several people were injured Saturday when they were pelted with stones as two political rival groups clashed in Eldoret town.
An Mbita candidate was assaulted in Langata at T-Mall. Police have accused political activist Brian Weke, along with a group of 10 men, of assaulting and attempting to kidnap him.

Residents of South Horr protested against the cancellation of the nominations in the Jubilee Coalition primary elections on 28/04/2017.
