They sat on the border of Samburu and Marsabit counties questioning why the nominations are held in the neighbouring Samburu and all other wards in Marsabit county but not in South Horr. No fatalities. The source does not indicate the exact time of the event.
On April 28, dozens of people were injured as police dispersed residents protesting the declaration of Laikipia governor Joshua Irungu as the Jubilee Party flagbearer.
Jubilee supporters protested at polling stations in Kiamaina (south of Gingalili village) over names missing from the register.
Jubilee supporters in Kabazi blocked voting temporarily to protest the low numbers of ballot papers available.
Jubilee supporters in Nairobi protested when Maina Kamanda won the primaries.
Jubilee supporters in Itiero, Bomorenda, rioted when the Jubilee primaries winner, George Karina, was announced. Police took charge and ordered all civilians out of the county tallying hall.
There were riots in polling stations around Kitutu Chache, as Jubilee supporters rejected the primaries.
Morans allegedly raided Kamunge village in the neighbouring Turkana County, killed one person and made away with an unknown number of livestock on Thursday last week.
Youth in Imenti South rioted and destroyed ballot boxes because they arrived after the votes had been tallied.
ODM supporters rioted in Kisumu Central when Ken Obura was declared winner of the primaries.

A house belonging to Mbita MP Millie Odhiambo was set ablaze on Wednesday as protests erupted in Homa Bay over the ODM party nominations. Ms Odhiambo's home in Koyani village in Lambwe was burnt as residents protested after she was announced winner in the Mbita Constituency ODM nominations. No casualties were reported.

Workers and farmers attached to Chemelil Sugar Company have called for resignation of top managers, accusing them of poor performance.The workers, who staged protests said the management and the board have failed to pay farmers and transporters since 2014.

assoc_actor_1: NASA: National Super Alliance; Vigilante Group (Kenya)
notes: One person is killed during an opposition NASA rally when he was accused of being a pickpocket by the demonstrators.
Voters in Bonchari protested the fact that the incumbent MP was given a direct nomination in the primaries. Voting was suspended.
ODM supporters angry that Millie Odhiambo won the party primaries rioted and burned her home.
Nyali residents protested the decision of the ODM election tribunal in Mombasa on 26/04/2017. The tribunal recommended repeating Nyali MP nominations.

In Kisumu town, police used teargas canisters to disperse youths who were protesting the award of the ODM ticket to Kisumu central MP Ken Obura.The youths argued that Mr Obura had been rigged in at the expense of Gem Central MCA Fred Ouda. An entourage of boda boda riders led by Kisumu governor Jack Ranguma, who were protesting the win of senator Anyang' Nyong'o for the ODM governorship ticket, were caught in the melee.Hundreds of Mr Ouda's supporters thronged the streets chanting his slogans.
One person was stabbed during a confrontation between two rival aspirants along Juja Road on Thursday. The case is under investigations
There were protests in Kiamaina ward in Bahati following cases of missing names in the register.
Jubilee voters in Mvita, Mombasa, protested when they realised that names were missing from the ballot papers.

Bishop Margaret Wanjiru, an aspirant for the Nairobi governorship and a group of supporters entered a polling centre and destroyed ballot papers when they complained of a distribution problem. The police arrested Wanjiru.
Police fired into the air to disperse a rowdy crowd of voters in Kiambu.
In Khalaba township, in Bungoma, supporters of different ANC factions broke into fistfights during the primaries. Several youths were injured.
Supporters of an Amani Coalition contestant rioted and blocked voting in the ANC primaries in Bwake/Luuya ward.
Voting materials reached polling stations late in the Webuye West ANC primaries, so voters broke the ballot boxes and destroyed the ballot papers in protest.
The Jubilee candidate for Nairobi and a group of her supporters stormed a Nairobi polling station and destroyed ballot papers. The police broke up the protest and arrested her.
ODM supporters at Kariokor polling station protested when the authorities announced that the ODM Nairobi primaries had been cancelled.

There was chaos at Kanja Primary School in Embu during the Jubilee Party nominations after a group of youths prevented Runyenjes MP Cecily Mbarire from forming a second stream at the centre. The youths protested outside the poll centre and threatened to eject Ms Mbarire

Police fired shots in the air to quell chaos that erupted in Homa Bay following the declaration of incumbent Governor Cyprian Awiti winner in the Orange Democratic Movement nominations.Police were called in to contain the situation after supporters of his opponents vowed not to accept the result of the hotly contested nomination, in which he was facing off with Kasipul MP Oyugi Magwanga and businessman Sammy Wakiaga
Voters tried to raid the DCC's office in Gatundu South when they realised that ballot boxes had gone missing.

assoc_actor_1: FORD-Kenya: Forum for the Restoration of Democracy-Kenya
notes: FORD-Kenya supporters burned their ballot papers at Masaba primary school, Kiminini after it was learned that other papers were not sent elsewhere in the constituency.

Mbita MP Millie Odhiambo reported the death of her 'supporter' at Homa Bay Police Station. She reported that he was knocked down by a vehicle belonging to one of her rivals which had been trailing her and attacked hermotorcade.An investigation has been launched.

assoc_actor_1: ODM: Orange Democratic Movement; Government of Kenya (2013-)
notes: The incumbent MP in Changamwe led a group of rowdy youth in storming polling stations and scaring away voters.
In Homa Bay Town Constituency, chaos erupted at Rodi Primary School polling station when officials decided to use exercise books as ballot papers. Police arrest youth and seize weapons.
Protests in Mwea, Kirinyaga County as voters apprehend returning officer and hand him to over police over allegations of rigging in Jubilee primaries.

Political activist Brian Weke was arrested over an alleged attack on an ODM Suba North constituency aspirant.Mr James Akali, who is seeking to dislodge incumbent Millie Odhiambo, was attacked in Nairobi at Lang'ata's T-Mall. He suffered injuries.

Disgruntled voters on Monday burnt ballot papers, protesting against the missing names of eight Member of the County Assembly aspirants.. Moments later, armed security officers arrived to find all the ballot papers completely destroyed

security guard attached to Mbita MP Millie Odhiambo was injured following violence during ODM nominations in the county on Monday.Chaos erupted after the MP's supporters clashed with those of her opponent James Akali.
Gunmen have seriously wounded 73-year-old conservationist Kuki Gallmann at her conservation park in the latest of a string of attacks during land invasions in drought-stricken northern Kenya.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: Police engage communal gunmen who attacked a conservationist. Two killed

actor2: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: GSU officers disperse angry supporters of Nicholas Wanyepe who were on April 23, 2017 protesting at the ODM Kilifi officers after he lost the Kilifi South parliamentary ticket to businessman Ken Chonga

Pokot raiders and police reservists engage in a firefight in Keiyo Valley on 22/04/2017. Four Pokot warriors and two civilians were killed in the shootout. According to the source, the attack could have been politically motivated and meant to intimidate communities not to take part in the Jubilee Coalition nominations.
Youths stormed the Msambweni polling station demanding to know why names were missing from the ODM register.
Supporters of MP Badi Twalib and aspirant Dan Aloo demonstrated outside a polling station over delays in the start of voting.

After voting delays in the ODM primary, supporters of MP Badi Twalib and aspirant Dan Aloo clashed outside Kwashee primary school polling centre. Mr Aloo' s supporters claimed the delays were to enable rigging.
Anti-riot police disperse angry voters at Hola who were prevented from voting by the agents of a gubernatorial aspirant
In Mau Summit, residents blocked the Kericho-Nakuru highway and the entrance to Mau Summit Secondary School protesting alleged vote rigging.
Youths barricaded the roads, stormed polling centres and burned ballot papers to protest the Jubilee primaries.
Youths barricaded the roads, stormed polling centres and burned ballot papers to protest the Jubilee primaries.
Youths barricaded the roads, stormed polling centres and burned ballot papers to protest the Jubilee primaries.
Residents of Imenti South block the Meru-Nairobi highway to protest over late arrival of ballot materials at Kaguru Agricultural Centre during the Jubilee Party primaries on April 21, 2017
Police disperse crowds protesting the against the delayed polling material for the Jubilee primaries.

Youths destroy ballot boxes and papers at Kiamugumo Primary School polling centre on 21/04/2017 disrupting the Jubilee Coalition primaries. They arrived to the polling station, when Anne Waiguru was voting, outpowering the police forces securing the station.
Voters in Kwanza burned their ballot papers to protest that the polls closed too early.
Voters burned their ballot papers in 5 polling stations in Laikipia East to protest the vote.

In Embu, voting in various parts was disrupted by a group of aspirants amid claims of rigging. Led by Runyenjes MP Cecily Mbarire and Manyatta MP John Muchiri, the aspirants stormed Kirimari Secondary School, where the ballot papers were being supplied, and demanded that the process be halted.
Violent protests and running battles with police occurred in Dandora after police shot a deaf boy they mistook for a robbery suspect. Injuries as a result of the protest are not known.
Scores are injured when unidentified armed youths launch a coordinated attack on a ODM meeting in Rongo.
Property destruction: A group of youths attacked a vehicle carrying ODM ballot materials in Mosando, Bogiakumu. The driver said he was blocked by individuals on motorbikes.
A man is killed by land invaders near Laikipia Nature Conversatory
Three are injured when they are attacked by unidentified perpetrators during the night-time hours. The attack may be related to an election on 24/04. Date of attack not known - source dated 21/04.
Dr Thuo Mathenge and his supporters protest outside Jubilee Party headquarters in Pangani on April 19, 2017 over the outcome of Nyeri governorship nomination.
After Sonko's rally in Umoja, rioting youth pillaged shops.
A Jubilee MP was shot at while he was campaigning in Nairobi. He has been hospitalised.
A group protesting against vote rigging claims attacks a lawmaker's aide at Aberdares Country Club hotel, near Githunguri on the evening of 18/04.
The aspiring ODM Naivasha candidate was arrested and held, and then admitted to hospital.
Supporters for different aspirants for the Jubilee ticket in Ruiru clash.
A Jubilee parliamentary aspirant has been admitted at a Eldoret hospital after he was attacked by people said to be his rival's supporters.
Members and supporters of ODM protest the use of IEBC registers during party primaries.
Non-violent activity: Mr Kenneth Kinyanjui, who is fighting for the Ikinu MCA's seat, went missing on Tuesday night before resurfacing on Tuesday
Jubilee supporters held protests in Baringo (in Kabarnet town) following accusations that the primaries were rigged.
ODM supporters of John Mbadi clash with those of Caroli Omondi at a party rally in Magunga on 17/04. Two reported injuries.
Sheila Githaiga, who is running for senate in Kieni, was ambushed and beaten by 30 men wielding batons and machetes.
Supporters of two governor primary candidates (Joseph Ole Lenku and Tarayia Ole Kores) of the Jubilee party clashed on 17/04/2017 in Namanga. Seven people were injured but there were no fatalities.

Two factions of ODM clash, those loyal to Governor John Mruttu and those of National Assembly Minority Whip Thomas Mwadeghu, at a party meeting over vote tampering. The two sides also became violent on 16/04 over the choice of election clerks.

Two factions of ODM clash, those loyal to Governor John Mruttu and those of National Assembly Minority Whip Thomas Mwadeghu, at a party meeting over vote tampering. The two sides also became violent on 16/04 over the choice of election clerks.

Residents claim that in the last two months 10 people have been killed (4 in March, 6 in April) in raids on several villages in Lamu and Tana River counties. Though mainly related to cattle theft, a resident believes 'some politicians were behind the raids.'

Residents claim that in the last two months 10 people have been killed (4 in March, 6 in April) in raids on several villages in Lamu and Tana River counties. Though mainly related to cattle theft, a resident believes 'some politicians were behind the raids.'

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: Two General Service Unit (GSU) officers are reported missing following a weekend shootout with herders at Matweku near the Laikipia Nature Conservancy at the border of Laikipia and Baringo counties.
Pokot militia raided several villages in Marakwet East, but were repulsed by the police.
In Migori, unidentified youths invaded a rally in Sori Town on Saturday evening, forcing ODM activist Peter Jobando, a licensed firearm holder, to fire in the air several times.

Protests broke out in Kabete, Kiambu County on 15/04 following the disappearance of a parliamentary aspirant. The politician was reported missing the previous night, while his car, riddled with bullet holes, was found early Saturday in Gitaru. The fate of his person is not known.
ODM party has cancelled nomination results for Khwisero constituency due to irregularities, resulting in protests. No reports of violence
A father of four is killed by 200 'land invaders' that villagers claim had been invading land claiming they were squatters, only to later sell it to private developers.
Residents corner and kill a man accused of joining in on a land seizure in which a local was killed.
Two suspected Islamist militants are killed in an extra-judicial killing by unidentified assailants in Naivasha. Both were suspected of recruiting and funding 'terror' activities.
Pokot militia raided several villages in Marakwet East, but were repulsed by the police.
There were intense firefights between Pokot militias and government forces near Olmaiso, in Laikipia.
A female Jubilee aspirant who is running for Tetu parliamentary seat, is attacked by four masked men armed with metal bars and a gun at Mbaaini village.

Supporters of MP Paul Otuoma of ODM protested the announcement of provisional results of the ODM Busia Governor nominations. Supporters shouted at the chairman of the county elections board and security agents had to take two men out of the hall, where the results where announced.
Non-violent activity: On Friday, the Kabete Jubilee parliamentary aspirant Charles Chege disappeared and resurfaced on Sunday morning

Pokot raiders attacked Matweku police post in Ol Ari Nyiro Nature Conservancy, killing a police officer and abducting two others on 13/04/2017. Later the captured policemen were found dead at Kamwenje in Baringo. It is believed that the policemen were killed by Pokots.
A police officer and a civilian died in a firefight between Pokot militias and government forces near Olmaiso, in Laikipia, on 13/04/2017.
Dozens of Kisumu residents protested over an alleged plot by the government to auction a local Sh4.2 billion mall.
ODM nominations in Busia County turned, with Deputy Governor Kizito Wangalwa's vehicle being smashed, its tires deflated and the driver attacked by rioting youth.
In Tharaka-Nithi, two supporters of Governor Samuel Ragwa were injured during the launch of Chuka/Igambangombe MP Muthomi Njuki's manifesto on April 12.
Gabra militia kills five Borana herders at Kubi Kalo; one on 11/04, four on 12/04.
Gabra militia kills five Borana herders at Kubi Kalo; one on 11/04, four on 12/04.
At least seven Pokot were killed by police during a security operation in Tiaty, Baringo County. The gunmen were allegedly planning a livestock raid.
Non-violent activity: 10 April, 23:00EAT, Mandera, Kenya: al Shabaab militants entered Mandera and hijacked two pick-up trucks.
In a crackdown on 'banditry', police set fire to a Pokot village. An infant dies during the raid.
4 people are killed by herders in Nakwomuru village in central Pokot county. Police reservists engage with the raiders, killing three of them
4 people are killed by herders in Nakwomuru village in central Pokot county. Police reservists engage with the raiders, killing three of them.
Raiders kill one person in Pokot north during a peace meeting
One person is feared dead and scores injured after supporters of Funyula MP Paul Otuoma and Busia Governor Sosepeter Ojamoong clashed in Funyula over the ODM primaries
Angry and rowdy youth chanting anti-Jubilee slogans disrupted the president's rally in Wajir and engaged the police. The police dispersed the rioters.
Sex workers in Mombasa staged a protest after a colleague was murdered by a client.

Nominated Senator Elizabeth Ongoro led her supporters to protest the direct nomination handed to her rival at Orange House, the ODM headquarters in Nairobi. A plain clothed security officer was forced to shoot in the air to disperse the rowdy youths who had stormed the party Headquarters and were roughing up ODM Executive Director Oduor Ongwen.
Pokot gunmen open fire at Ol Moran livestock market in bid to steal cattle. There are no references to injuries. But the police engage the gunmen in a battle later. No deaths reported
Sex workers protest at the deputy county commissioner's office demanding justice after a murder of a colleague.
The car of ODM politician Hassan Joho was attacked by gunmen. Joho's bodyguard was shot and injured but no fatalities is reported. Joho claims it to be an attempt of assassination.
Factions of ODM members clash during a rally. He groups were divided over support of Governor Zachary Okoth Obado and gubernatorial candidate Ochillo Ayacko.
Unidentified arsonists petrol-bombed the Migori ODM offices ahead of a party rally the following day.
Two Administration Police officers were attacked and set ablaze in Voi at the weekend when they were mistaken to be thugs.

Residents of Kisumu protested peacefully over a delay in the opening of a mall. The opening has been delayed by ambiguities of bank loan payments. The protest was led by the director of Youth Reconciliation Forum of Kenya Eric Okello.
Video released on socia media shows a police kill an unarmed man in Eastleigh on 31/03/2017. The victim was suspected of killing two police officers last month.

Property destruction: Suspected 'cattle herders' burn down a tourist lodge on the Laikipia Plateau. The herders may have torched the lodge in retaliation to an ongoing security operation in the area. The hotel was empty at the time of the attack.
Movement of forces: Suspected Al-Shabaab hijacked a Kenyan government vehicle in the border town of Elwak in Mandera country. The attackers released the driver and reportedly drove into Somalia.
When police blocked Hassan Joho's supporters and the press from following him into the police headquarters, the supporters protested in the streets of Mombasa.
Mukutan Lodge was attacked by herders seeking pasture. They exchanged gunfire with the security forces and burned down the lodge.
Two unidentified neighbouring communities clash in Garissa, along its border with Wajir over a boundary dispute. One bystander was reportedly killed in the clash. Date not clear - source dated 28/03.
Beach operators protest against a competitor's construction of a sea wall.
A boda boda driver on the Jubilee campaign was stabbed to death by a fellow campaigner over campaign payments. Attacker assumed to be Jubilee.
A young boy is killed by armed raiders involved in a boundary dispute. It is not known in the victim was specifically targeted. Exact date not clear - source dated 28/03.
Kenyans in Namanga [border town] demonstrated against Tanzanian leader John Magufuli on Monday [27 March], saying he had deported their counterparts.

Attackers believed to be from the Bahgere clan from Wajir South attacked Fadiwein village, which is inhabited by Auliyan community, injuring one. Eleven houses were also burnt and the attackers made away with 300 goats and five camels. The two communities had been fighting over a disputed boundary with the Bahgere, claiming the area falls under Wajir South, while Auliyan says it is in Garissa county.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: An unidentified middle aged man who accessed a restricted area of the state house was shot by GSU.

Violence erupted in a political rally of the Orange Democratic Movement (ODM) on 27/03/2017 in Kendu Bay. Supporters of two rival politicians of the same party, Governor Cyprian Awiti and Mr. Oyugi Magwanga, clashed injuring three people. No fatalities.

At least two children were killed and three others injured on 25/03 after explosion went off in a unnamed village in Mandera county. Authorities suspect al Shabaab, though no group has claimed responsibility.

Following an alleged murder of a woman over a land dispute on 12/03/2017, villagers and the victim's family members attacked the houses of the suspects on 24/03/2017 in Riabotenene. Seven houses were burnt and their occupants were chased away. No fatalities.

The mother of Pastor Pius Muiru was found dead on 23/03/2017 in her farm in Karika village in Muranga. Police suspect that she was kidnapped and subsequently killed. Her son is the founder of an evangelical church and was the presidential candidate in 2007 for Kenya People's Party.
A Jubilee Party meeting attended by elected officials turned chaotic after their supporters clashed at the Bomas of Kenya over the election of the party's County Elections Board.
Police assault and arrest a journalist in Usengi. The scribe was targeted for investigating the use of excessive force by the officers who have been recently harming and harassing residents.
Ten people were killed and four injured in a cattle raid in Marti, Samburu, on 22/03/2017. It is believed to be a retaliatory attack run by thieves of a neighbouring community.
Dozens of residents from Sook, West Pokot County held a protest in Kapenguria over corruption and mismanagement of the county's bursary fund.
A group of several minor political parties protest at the office of the electoral commission to demand a meeting with leadership in an effort of moving an electoral deadline.
Police officers 'torture' a youth for unknown reason. A protest against the act followed.
Police officers 'torture' a youth for unknown reason. A protest against the act followed.
A man suspected of being a thief was lynched by locals in Ngangarithi village in Nyeri town.
A NASA political aspirant was reportedly shot dead on 20/3. Location not known - party headquarters in Nairobi.
At least 10 people have been killed in Kom, Isiolo County between Borana and Samburu militias. The clash was spurred over drought.
On 19/03 in Mukutani, four police officers were wounded when suspected Pokot herdsmen fired on their vehicle as they escorted members of the Ilchamus community to safety.
Three are killed in a clash between Turkana and Samburu militias. The clash was sparked by revenge for cattle theft.
Kenya's president deployed the military to quell violence related to drought.
Lawmakers in the Mandera County Assembly clash over disagreements of a bill. Political parties not known.
Students at a Maseno school go on 'rampage' over disagreements of their institution's leadership.
The KDF engaged Al Shabaab fighters at Kolbio.

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
notes: Pokot fighters attacked a Red Cross convoy that was evacuating children injured in the attack on Mukutani the previous evening. 4 police officers were injured.

Residents claim that in the last two months 10 people have been killed (4 in March, 6 in April) in raids on several villages in Lamu and Tana River counties. Though mainly related to cattle theft, a resident believes 'some politicians were behind the raids.'
Jubilee supporters damaged property in Nairobi during the bids to select the election boards.

Residents claim that in the last two months 10 people have been killed (4 in March, 6 in April) in raids on several villages in Lamu and Tana River counties. Though mainly related to cattle theft, a resident believes 'some politicians were behind the raids.'
Jubilee supporters damaged property in Muranga during the bids to select the election boards.
Jubilee supporters damaged property in Nairobi during the bids to select the election boards.
One is dead and several others injured when supporters of Senator Elizabeth Ongoro and Ruaraka MP TJ Kajwang, both ODM, clash in Mathare.
A group protests poor security following a spate of attack from Somali 'bandits.'

In a continuance of ethnic violence, two Pokot woman are killed by suspected Tugen-Ilchamus raiders, after an attack on a police vehicle. It is not clear if the Pokot women were affiliated with the police, or if the police were simply caught in crossfire. In retaliation, Pokot militias soon after attacked Mukutan market, killing five women and four children and looting shops and homes. Other were reported injured.

In a continuance of ethnic violence, two Pokot woman are killed by suspected Tugen-Ilchamus raiders, after an attack on a police vehicle. It is not clear if the Pokot women were affiliated with the police, or if the police were simply caught in crossfire. In retaliation, Pokot militias soon after attacked Mukutan market, killing five women and four children and looting shops and homes. Other were reported injured.

In a continuance of ethnic violence, two Pokot woman are killed by suspected Tugen-Ilchamus raiders, after an attack on a police vehicle. It is not clear if the Pokot women were affiliated with the police, or if the police were simply caught in crossfire. In retaliation, Pokot militias soon after attacked Mukutan market, killing five women and four children and looting shops and homes. Other were reported injured.

Two are dead in a clash between Tugen-Ilchamus and Pokot group after the former attempted a raid to steal cattle in Baringo County. The clash lead to further ethnic violence in the following days. Exact location in Baringo was not reported by the source, though it stands to reason the violence occurred in Mukutani ward, as subsequent attacks occurred in Mukutan.

Auliyan militia attacked Duse centre in Isiolo County in a retaliatory attack following their expulsion for the area by government forces weeks prior. Five killed, six injured. Two of the attackers were shot and killed by police.

Auliyan militia attacked Duse centre in Isiolo County in a retaliatory attack following their expulsion for the area by government forces weeks prior. Five killed, six injured. Two of the attackers were shot and killed by police.
Members of Jubilee and NASA parties clash during a political convention. The unrest occurred on either 9 March or 10 March.
Auliyan militia attacked Garba Tula, killing a 70-year old man. The attack is believed to be related to revenge after being forces off land.
Supporters of Homa Bay Governor Cyprian Awiti and Kasipul MP Oyugi Magwanga clash with crude weapons in Kendu Bay, leaving one seriously injured.
Al-Shabaab fighters have attacked a Kenyan military convoy at Lamu. Al Shabaab claimed killing four. Kenya acknowledged the attack, but said only one was killed.

Police dispersed Kisumu Water and Sewerage Company (Kiwasco) employees after they held protests threatening to evict their director from office, grievance not clear. Police and protesters engaged in running battles.
Protest in the Rhamu over a proposed county budget.
Protests in the towns of Kotulo, Banisa and Takaba, Mandera County on 06/03 over a proposed government budget.
Protests in the towns of Kotulo, Banisa and Takaba, Mandera County on 06/03 over a proposed government budget.
Protests in the towns of Kotulo, Banisa and Takaba, Mandera County on 06/03 over a proposed government budget.

Armed raiders invading a ranch shot dead a Briton in northern Kenya's Laikipia County on the evening of 05/03. The victim was shot dead after he went to inspect the remains of a friend's home that had been burnt down by raiders on 03/03. Related, on 04/03, a police helicopter was shot at in the same farm as security officers carried out aerial surveillance. A second source claims the attack took place on 6 March.
On 04/03, a police helicopter was shot at by Pokot or Samburu raidersas security officers carried out aerial surveillance.
Property destruction: A UK national's home that had been burnt down by Pokot or Samburu raiders on 03/03.
Unidentified gunmen kidnapped three teachers from Dadaab camp. Al Shabaab have carried out abductions in the past, though it is not clear who the perpetrators were in this instance.

Traders and hawkers clashed on 01/03. A court order released on 24 February by the Milimani Commercial Courts had allowed the return of hawkers to trade on two streets in Eastleigh. Traders however protested the court's move leading to Wednesday's clashes.

Eight are dead in clashes between Tugen-Ilchamus and Pokot clans during the weeks of 26/02-12/03, exact dates, location and other details not known. Accounting for the activity between the clans in the present week, the fatality total stands at 21.

Jubilee Party youths opposed to the National Super Alliance (Nasa) have blocked Raila Odinga and Kalonzo Musyoka from addressing a rally at a scheduled venue. The mob on Monday used rocks to barricade the entrance to Meru town main stage, forcing the two leaders to keep off.
Residents torched 14 trucks and a Land Cruiser in Mariashoni, Molo after one of the truck drivers hit and killed a boda boda rider and his passenger.
Protest against the state of roads block traffic in Kayole.
Security forces kill a suspected al Shabaab member in Kwale and recover weapons.
A 45-year-old man was lynched on the weekend (25-26 February) when neighbours found him sleeping with the corpse of his 15 year old daughter in Molo Township.
Three are killed in clashes over land in the Athi River area. Following, police made 92 arrests.

Three suspected remnants of the Sabaot Land Defence Force were on 24/02 lynched by residents in Cheptais, Mt Elgon. The attackers also torched the suspects' houses. The attackers suspected the three recently murdered a man.
Boda boda riders in Maralal Town held demonstrations over alleged misappropriation of funds meant for construction of shades.

Security Measures: More than 30 schools have been closed due to persistent attacks by armed Pokot militia in Baringo county. Closed schools include Ngaratuko, Chemoe, Yatya, Tuluk, Kagir, Loruk, Chepkesin, Kapturo, Toboroi, Barsuswo and Lokorotabim in Baringo North.
On 22 February, one person was shot dead in Loruk by Pokot militants as 400 residents fled after their homes were set on fire.

On 22 February, police found the bodies of four men in a vehicle in Gitaru. Police said they appeared to have been strangled to death and had visible injuries in their necks and faces. The reason for their deaths was not established.
Three are attacked and killed with blunt objects in Garissa on the night of 22/02. Perpetrators not known.
On 22 February, a teacher was killed by Pokot militants in Chepkesin in Baringo North.
Clinical officers in Narok County on 22/02 staged demonstrations and camped outside the county headquarters demanding promotions and harmonisation of their salaries.
Striking universities lecturers hold a peaceful demonstrations in Nairobi to demand implementation of a 2013-2017 collective bargaining agreement.
Two more people were killed in Baringo county in attacks by armed Pokot militants. Specific details not provided.
Kilif nurses protest unpaid allowances.

Residents of Nakuru took to the streets to protest the ownership of a piece of land in Mwariki. Police dispersed the more than 100 residents of Mutegi Estate who had blocked the Nakuru-Kiambogo road using stones.
On 19 February, Pokot militants killed a young mother and her three-year old child at Natan in Baringo North. Another source reported that the attack took place on 21 February.
On 18 February, two local leaders, MCA Kibet Cheretei and a Jubilee MP hopeful Pepe Kitambaa were shot dead by Pokot militants at a bar in Marigat town.
A fight between a Pokot and Marakwet near Kerio River led to the death of one.

Armed youths disrupt an ODM rally in Katilia. Opposition leader Raila Odinga was speaking at the time of the attack. The youths were accused of being incited by MPs to disrupt the event. Police fired in the air to disperse the crowd. Injuries not known.

On 17 February, four people were seriously injured after suspected Pokot assailants attacked a bus carrying former Inspector General David Kimaiyo's relatives. The attack occurred on the Chesongoch-Liter road, near Tot trading centre.
On 14 February, university lecturers protested in Nairobi after doctors were jailed for refusing to call off their strike. They are also protesting over low wages.
On 14 February, police fired teargas to disperse protesting youth from Mathare who barricaded the road over claims of illegal voter registration.
County workers protest a breach of government contract by dumping sewage at a county office.
Residents clash with police in Mugumoini village over a land surveying issue. A man was shot and injured.
At least 12 houses were torched in Pimbinyiet, Trans Mara West after clashes between two communities lasted over two days.
A police officer was hacked to death at Mangala in Makueni County by a group of sand harvesters over the right to land.
At least 12 houses were torched in Pimbinyiet, Trans Mara West after clashes between two communities lasted over two days.
Residents protest in Subukia after a student is killed the previous day by 'thugs.'

Herders, illegally trespassing on land, injure a police officer and burn homes in Miteta, Ng'arua Division in Laikipia when they were confronted by a police. The violence comes 24 hours after a similar confrontation near Rumuruti.
Police shoot in the air and lob teargas canisters to disperse violent residents of Simba Chai in Teso South, Busia County who were protesting after they were allegedly denied national Identity cards.
On 8 February, a 43-year-old man was hacked to death in a dispute between two factions of a family over land in Kinangop, Nyandarua county. Four attackers, armed with pangas attacked the family home.
Youths protest during an address by the Kisii governor at Ekona. The demonstrators were demanding better government services.
On 8 February, Samburu residents protested against Raila Odinga, burning posters and lighting bonfires.
On 8 February, an 82-year-old man who is the uncle of Kapseret MP was shot dead by heavily armed militants who raided his home in Kerio Valley.
Armed herders trespassing on illegal land shoot and injure a police officer after they were confronted near Rumuruti.
On 6 February, a protest was held over the death of a motorist who was hit by a speeding vehicle. Protesters called on the government to erect speed bumps.
Two public service vehicles were on 04/02 burnt down along Lang'ata Road in Nairobi by rioters after several had been in area accidents.

On 3 February, Eunice Wambui (aka Nyasuguta from Vitimbi), an actress who has been campaigning to become the MP for Embakasi South, was beaten with wooden rods by four political goons in Mukuru Kwa Ruben.

100+ gunmen believed to be al-Shabaab attacked a police post and destroyed communication masts in Arabia area, Mandera County. At least one bystander died in the attack. Number of other casualties not known, as al Shabaab had destroyed communication masts in the area. Shabelle Media Network reports an 'unknown number of police officers were killed.'
Tea farmers on Kirinyaga protest against the sale of company land. Location not known.
On 29 January, two suspected criminals were stoned to death by villagers at Othoro marke, Rachuonyo East subcounty.
National Alliance supporters, specifically that of Senator Mike Sonko, attack journalists covering a visit from the Governor. Injuries reported. The attack occurred on or before 25/01.
Protesters force an ODM rally in Changamwe to end prematurely.
Youth in Isiolo Town protest over what they termed as delays in the vetting process for issuing national identification cards.
A Kenya Police Reservist (KPR) was killed after suspected Al-Shabaab perpetrators hurled explosives at a bank and two hotels in Mandera town on the morning of 23/01.
A group of vigilantes attack and kill two they suspect of robbery.
On 22 January, residents in Kitungati village (Kitui) blocked police from removing the body of a man killed the day before by Somali militants.
Three are killed in a land dispute in Kanyakwar. The following day a group protest at the office of the 'assistant chief', claiming he 'had a hand in the dispute.'
On 21 January, suspected Somali militia shot dead a herder in Ukasi, Kitui county.

On 21 January, a man was shot in the waist and a woman was beaten after police clashed with squatters on disputed land in Nguu Tatu, Kisauni constituency, Mombasa. The squatters threw stones and shot arrows at police who lobbed teargas canisters to disperse them.
Three are killed in a land dispute in Kanyakwar. The following day a group protest at the office of the 'assistant chief', claiming he 'had a hand in the dispute.'

On 19 January, Machakos University lecturers protested on Makueni-Machakos road. Lecturers in several parts of the country defied a court order and began their strike for the government to implement a 2013 pay rise agreement. Machakos University lecturers protested on Makueni-Machakos road.
On 19 January, medical students in Nairobi protested disruptions to their studies during the doctors' strike.

On 19 January, Egerton University lecturers protested in Nakuru. Lecturers in several parts of the country defied a court order and began their strike for the government to implement a 2013 pay rise agreement.

Residents engaged police and Kenya Wildlife officers in running battles for most of Wednesday after a resident was killed by an elephant who had invaded a farm at Sironi village, Laikipia West Sub-County. The residents barricaded the busy Nyahururu-Ng'arua road at Maili Saba junction, causing a gridlock. The group demanded the government construct an electrified fence to protect them from further attacks.
On 16 January, Kowow clan and residents of Maron sub-location clashed. Several houses were torched in Marakwet East after the body of a 62 year old woman was found.
Two woman who were accused of witchcraft are lynched in Nyamokenye village, Nyamira on the evening of 14/01.

A suspect behind a spate of motorbike theft and rape cases was Friday lynched in Kelonget village in Bomet Central. Irate public set the man's house blaze before stoning him to death and setting his body on fire after an extended search.
Non-violent activity: Heavily armed Somali militia/herders are reported to have encorached onto farms in Kitui, armed with AK-47s and displaced unprotected farmer settlements.

A group of angered boda boda operators attack a full passenger bus, setting it alight. The boda boda rider were angered after a colleague was injured in an accident. All passengers escaped, no casualties.

A bystander student was killed on Sunday as renewed clashes between the Kipsigis and Maasai communities escalated at Pimbinyiet on the Trans Mara West-Trans Mara East border in Narok County. A similar clash took place at the location on 04/01.

Busia County residents have destroyed properties in protest to the killing of a boda boda rider by a police officer. torched a police Land Cruiser and four houses (three belonging to Administration Police officers and one for the chief). The driver had been shot during a traffic stop.
One is dead following clashes between Kipsigis and Maasai militias at Pimbinyiet on the Trans Mara West-Trans Mara East border in Narok County.

Residents blocked the Nyeri-Karatina road to protest rising accidents. The residents barricaded the road using stones and bonfires and urged the Kenya National Highway Authority to erect speed bumps to reduce the number of accidents.
On 2 January, Somali militants shot dead two herders in Inyanzae.
Residents block roads in protest of pollution of a nearby river.
A Kipsigis man is dead and others are injured following an attack from suspected Maasai militia at Esoit, Junction and Kirindon in Trans Mara West. Similar violence had occurred in recent weeks.

Non-violent activity: Pokot bandits have resorted to blocking roads using twigs and stones. Currently, they have barricaded Makutani-Arabal road, Norokwei-Kiserian road and speculation is high that they are likely to close the Arabal-Sirata road in a bid to block security officers from flushing them out of their hideouts.

One person was killed on the night of 26/12 while three others sustained serious injuries following an attack by suspected Pokot militia in Chesongoch, Kerio Valley. A similar attack occurred earlier in the week.
On 26 December, 20 people were injured as residents from Matundura and Gituro villages (Naivasha and Kinangop constituencies) clashed over a boundary dispute.
Non-violent activity: on 25 December, a group of suspected Pokot militia raided a village near Arabel and forced locals who were attending a church service to flee. No one was injured.
On 24 December, Somali militants who have encroached Kitui county and posing as herders, gunned down a man in Katangini.
On 24 December, one person was shot and injured when suspected Pokot militia raided Chemwoyo and Murkutwo. Marakwet herders retaliated leading to an hour of heavy gunfire.

One attacker died and three police officers were wounded Friday after a group of men armed with machetes and bows assaulted a coastal police post to steal guns, an official said. No group has claimed responsibility, but initial suspicion has fallen on a secessionist group called the Mombasa Republican Council that wants the coastal region to secede from Kenya, claiming marginalization.
At least two people were killed and some others injured by suspected al-Shabaab who vandalized a communication mast in the Tarbaj area near the border with Somalia.
Lawmakers from major opposition parties in Kenya staged a walkout from a parliamentary session to protest the passage of a contentious legal provision.

Three people were on 21/12 are killed in Esoit, Trans Mara West (outside Kilgoris) in Narok County as fighting between the Kipsigis and Maasai communities. The fighting was an escalation of tit-for-tat attacks the previous day.
A Kipsigis is killed by people believed to be from the Maasai community outside Kilgoris at Esoit trading centre. The attack led to retaliation from Kipsigs militia.
More than 600 demonstrators from Sagalla in Taita Taveta County on 20/12 blocked the Nairobi-Mombasa highway to protest against increased cases of human-wildlife conflict in the area.
Members of a Kipsigs militia attack and kill two Maasai in retaliation for earlier violence.

On 20 December, interclan skirmishes were reported in the Kerio Valley. This is a continuation from the previous day. 25 houses were burned and two people were killed in total in the attacks. Fatalities coded on 19 December.
Members of the Kabsiren clan attacked and killed two of their Kapshoi counterparts accusing them of 'harbouring their enemies' from the Pokot community.

Pokot raiders attack and kill a crossing guard during in Liter village and two others in neighbouring Endo Location, both in the Kerio valley the early morning hours. The attacks led to ethnic tension in the area.

Former Kitui mayor was crushed to death and a former Land minister was injured after protests against the demolition of kiosks turned riotous in Kitui town. Following the incident, the driver of the truck defended himself, claiming the protesters threatened to lynch him and burn the truck.
Nurses at the Nyeri County Referral Hospital have on 16/12 held a peaceful demonstration protesting over delayed payments and promotions.
Migori government workers strike and protest over pay.
Military forces kill four members of al Shabaab in Hulugho during the mid-morning of 15/12.
Three journalists were reported assaulted by 'county officials' at Nyakongo school, Nyamira County.
Residents 'recently' protest the high number of traffic accidents in the area.

Suspected Al-Shabaab have attacked Dabacity in Elwak, Mandera County and destroyed a Safaricom telecommunication mast. County Commissioner Fredrick Shisia said the attack occurred at about 1.45am on 12/12.The attackers overpowered five security operatives guarding the mast, causing them to flee.
Police arrest three and use tear gas during an anti-government corruption protest in Kenya. No violence reported from the protesters.
On 12 December, supporters of Senator Kiraitu Murungi and Governor Peter Munya clashed at Meru Technical Training Institute. Opposing groups threw chairs at each other.
A military patrol encounters and kill four suspected members of al Shabaab in the Hulugho area on 09/12.
On 8 December, striking doctors and nurses protested in Kitui town as a country-wide boycott enters its fourth day.

Residents of Mercy Njeri area of Nakuru county on the evening of 03/12 evening blocked the Nakuru- Kabarak road as they protested the killing of two brothers by a police officer (details of incident not clear.)

Three people are injured in Mandera after their fuel tanker ran over an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) between Kotulo and Chuma Mrefu. Al Shabaab suspected. A similar attack against police occurred earlier in the week.
Property destruction: Offices of the Vihiga County government are destroyed by unidentified arsonists.

Residents of Kathwana in Tharaka-Nithi demonstrated over a statement made by the Deputy President which appeared to suggest the national government does not recognise the town as the counties headquarters.

The day after a group of armed robbers shot and killed a teacher, residents of Isebania border town block roads in protest. They engaged in running battles with police who dispersed them with tear gas.
Suspected al Shabaab target police with an IED in Mandera. No causalities.
Traders protest forced eviction in Isiolo.

assoc_actor_1: KPAWU: Kenya Plantation and Agricultural Workers Union
notes: Workers of a tea company strike and protest over pay.
On 28 November, activists demonstrated to protest against rising cases of sexual and gender-based violence in Uhuru Park, Nairobi.
On 27 November, a woman was killed and a 12-year old girl injured in a shootout near Lomelo between armed pastoralists. The Rift Valley coordinator dismissed reports that 14 people were shot dead.

Unidentified gunmen open fire on a group of students sitting for examination in Wajir. The gunmen later exchanged fire with police with were guarding the institution. Motive not known. No reported deaths.

Unidentified gunmen open fire on a group of students sitting for examination in Wajir. The gunmen later exchanged fire with police with were guarding the institution. Motive not known. No reported deaths.
On 22 November, Uber drivers demonstrated in Nairobi over low prices.
Al Shabaab attacked Haluqa, outside of Garissa, targeting a Safaricom building. The attackers abducted several workers and took them into Somalia.
A clash between Jimo and Agoro clans lasts over two days. One death reported the first day, two the second.
On 20 November, hundreds of National Youth Service (NYS) cohorts in Chuka protested that they could not access their savings. They chanted anti-Jubilee slogans.

Property destruction: on 20 November, a group of unknown people armed with machetes and rungus attempted to break into the house of the Mvita MP in Majengo Sega area of Mvita. They pelted the house with stones and smashed a car. No injuries reported.
Four Al-Shabaab members were killed in El-Wak, Mandera County after a combined team of security officers thwarted a planned terror attack against specific high value targets including police camps.
A clash between Jimo and Agoro clans lasts over two days. One death reported the first day, two the second.

Police lobbed teargas canisters and shot in the air to disperse a group of youths allied to Governor Mwangi wa Iria. The youths attempted to storm Mumbi grounds which has been booked by Kigumo MP Jamleck Kamau. During the protest the demonstrators sang anti-Kamau songs.
Movement of forces: Al Shabaab enters two villages in Ijara sub-county, forcing residents to hear a lecture in their local mosque.
Dozens of students from Kisii Universitys Eldama Ravine campus demonstrated against the closure of the university.
A vigilante group lynches a suspected murderer at Nthangarine, in Meru County.
Taxi operators protest competition from Uber in Nairobi.
A man was shot dead and two other people injured as police battled a villagers protesting the killing of two guards.

Bahati residents blocked the Nakuru-Nyahururu road disrupting transport activities for over three hours on Wednesday after the county government allegedly failed to help in retrieving a body of a boy from a dam.
On 7 November, over 50 Kisumu based journalists protested against police brutality.
Bomet Governor Isaac Rutos Chama cha Mashinani supporters clashed with those of Jubilee Party at Silbwet Stadium forcing police to tear gas them to quell the situation.
Six people died and two others were injured in fighting between Jibril and Matan clans in Wajir county [in northeast Kenya] on Saturday.
One person has died while eight others have been injured in morning clashes between the Kisii and Kipsigis groups at Olmelil along the Narok-Kisii border.
Residents of Uruku in Meru on Saturday held demonstrations outside Uruku police post protesting the death of a suspect in one of the cells.
Jubilee supporters protest at the appointment by the Deputy President. Police made arrests.
On 3 November, police beat anti-corruption protesters with batons and fired volleys of tear gas to disperse them from the location at Uhuru Park. They also attacked journalists covering the protests.
Police disperse an anti-corruption protest with tear gas.
Students of Nyabururu Girls High School in Kisii County are protesting the interdiction of their principal after reports of abuse.
University of Maseno students attack and kill a man they believed murdered a colleague.
On 31 October, students at Maseno University went on a rampage after a third year student was killed. They lit bonfires and stoned passing motorists. Police used tear gas to disperse the students.
Residents of Muranga protest after the local county bought land below market price. The demonstrators attempted to enter county officers, but were dispersed by police.
A prisoner released on Presidential pardon is lynched in Salawa.
Primary school students from Mwahe Primary School (near Keringet) rioted over the alleged defilement of a girl by a teacher. Six pupils were arrested. Source dated 28 October.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: A man was shot and killed by Kenyan police outside the US embassy in the capital Nairobi on Thursday after stabbing a GSU officer with a knife. IS later claimed responsibility.

Near violence at Mochengo polling centre in Nyacheki on Wednesday after a member of Kisii County Assembly (Jubilee Party) opened fire to disperse a group of 'rowdy' ODM youths who where attempting to attack him over bribery concerns.
On 26 October, students at Moi University's Coast campus in Mombasa protested after lecturers have not been paid and classes have been disrupted.
Two children sustained gunshot injuries on Tuesday night when a lone gunman attacked the home of ODM candidate Josphat Ekeno ahead of a by-election.

Al Shabaab gunmen detonated explosives at Boshari Guesthouse during the early morning hours. Twelve killed, others injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility, saying the targets of their attacks were Christians. Police later imposed a dusk till dawn curfew.

On 23 October, angry youths suspected of being hired by political rivals confronted a Labour Party member at a church in Jomvu, Mombasa. The party secretary was attacked in his car and money stolen. No reported injuries.
On 21 October, residents of Utawala (Nairobi) barricaded the Eastern bypass to protest the KDF closing the Mihango and Kayole road.
A widow was beheaded by a vigilante mob in Samogara Village, Kisii County over allegations of witchcraft.
Kisii University students burned a section of the administration block in protest over an order to clear school fees by Monday or postpone their studies. Anti-riot police quelled the riots.
A night guard was on Monday night killed by a stray bullet during a shootout between police and suspected al Shabaab gunmen in Mandera. One death reported.
Police use tear gas to disperse an ongoing contactors protest when they had become 'rowdy.'
Elders protested a meeting at Chuka University on Saturday, accusing a patron of favouritism.
Contractors protest delayed payments at the county offices on Hola over several days.
Contractors protest delayed payments at the county offices on Hola over several days.
Victims of a bank heist protest.
Hundreds of residents of Karatina in Nyeri County took to the streets to protest a two-day water shortage that has hit the town.
Contractors protest delayed payments at the county offices on Hola over several days.
Contractors protest delayed payments at the county offices on Hola over several days.
Students riot after their examination results are posted publicly.
Isiolo County staff protest a work stoppage.
A farmer is attacked and killed over land in the Kosovo area of Naivasha.
Protesters blocked the busy Eldoret-Malaba highway after five guards were killed by unknown persons the previous evening. Police fired in the air to disperse the protesters.
On 9 October, a man was attacked by a police officer in Baragoi, Sumburu. He had been pelted with stones.
A man was burnt to death by a mob in Meru after he allegedly stabbed a guard to death.
A cross-border al Shabaab attack kills six in Mandera. The attackers targeted 'non-locals' and/or 'Christians.'
Three days of unrest were reported (starting 3 October) as students at Masinde Muliro university main campus in Kakamega violently protested after the University Senate declined to review fees.
Three days of unrest were reported (starting 3 October) as students at Masinde Muliro university main campus in Kakamega violently protested after the University Senate declined to review fees.
Residents protest a water shortage in Garissa.
A group of Anglicans protest in support of their Bishop who was in the process of being sued for defamation.
On 3 October, students at Masinde Muliro university main campus in Kakamega protested over newly introduced charges/fees and stoned a building used by security officials.
Residents barricade a road, lighting fires in protest of a recent alleged accidental killing of a tuk tuk driver at the hands of police.
Pedestrians protest against reckless motorists.

Police on Tuesday used tear gas to disperse protesters in Eldoret town after they took to the streets over the summoning of two governors to record statements over utterances they made when they stormed Moi University to oppose the appointment of a new vice-chancellor. There were also protests in Iten town over the same issue.
University students, protesting the death of a colleague due to accident, engage the police in running battles near Ongata Rongai. Two students and two police officers sustained injury.
Police kill an al Shabaab recruiter during a shootout.

Police on Tuesday used tear gas to disperse protesters in Eldoret town after they took to the streets over the summoning of two governors to record statements over utterances they made when they stormed Moi University to oppose the appointment of a new vice-chancellor. There were also protests in Iten town over the same issue.

Residents blocked the Mombasa-Lunga Lunga road on Friday after one person died and six others were injured in an accident involving two matatus and a truck. The residents lit bonfires and barricaded the road with stones to protest frequent crashes on the road.
Al Shabaab, numbering 50, attacks a police station in Liboi. One of the assailants was killed and several seriously injured during a gunbattle.
Al Shabaab attacks a police station in Hamey, near Garissa. The insurgents killed six officers and captured two others.
Doctors protest over pay in Nairobi.
Journalists in Mombasa protest limits on free expression and other harassing behaviour.
A mob from Kiawara slums in Nyeri Sunday night lynched a former robbery convict after he attempted to steal from a house.

Two rival groups, those supportive of the Kirinyaga governor (TNA) and those supportive of a influential businesswoman clashed at the site of a marathon. Police intervened and dispersed the two groups.
Protesters marched in Kenyas capital against plans to build an elevated railway line over the countries oldest national park, saying it will threaten wildlife.
Students of Siakago Boys High School in Embu County went on the rampage Tuesday night, protesting the shaming of their colleagues who were earlier in the day found swimming in a river.
Residents protest recent banditry in their area.
Ethnic clash over rights of a watering hole near Molot. Several houses were burnt in the melee.
High school students riot after they are denied a social event with a nearby girls school.

A group of three women (later learned to had pledged allegiance to Islamic State) attack a police station in Mombasa. The three entered the police station on 11/09 under the guise to report a stolen phone. One drew a knife, the second threw an explosive and the third attempted to detonate a dud suicide pack. The officers responded and killed the three. Two police injured. A fourth suspect was arrested in the following days.

At least four more people have been killed in raging armed conflict between Borana and Somali herders (Auliyan) along the Isiolo-Garissa border [northeastern Kenya]. The fighting took place in Tana village about 11km north of Garba-Tula town on Saturday [10 September].

Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for double roadside explosions targeted Kenyan defence forces near the town of Mandera on 09/09. Pro-al shabaab media outlets, citing unnamed commander reported that at least 4 Kenyan army soldiers died in the IED blasts on the KDF military convoy.
Miraa farmers and traders in Nyambene, Meru County (near Meru Town) took to the streets protesting the recent ban on Kenyan khat planes to Somalia.
A Borana man is attacked and killed by Somali herders in Garfasa, Isiolo County. The attack is believed to be retaliatory.
Journalists protest in several cities following the mysterious death (attributed to thugs) of a colleague.
Journalists protest in several cities following the mysterious death (attributed to thugs) of a colleague.
Journalists protest in several cities following the mysterious death (attributed to thugs) of a colleague.
Journalists protest in several cities following the mysterious death (attributed to thugs) of a colleague.
Journalists protest in several cities following the mysterious death (attributed to thugs) of a colleague.

On September 7, 2016, unidentified assailants forced themselves into the house of photojournalist Denis Otieno in the town of Kitale, Rift Valley, and demanded photos in his camera before shooting him dead.
Tea farmers protest over pay in Gianchore.
Students protest over the transfer of their teacher.
Tea farmers protest over pay in Tombe.

Students from St Pauls Kevote High School in Embu County on Thursday held a peaceful demonstration over the transfer of their principal Mr Paul Muriuki to Nkubu High School. During the protest the students walked from their school to nearby Embu.
A section of Rui-Ruiru coffee farmers in Kiamariga staged a protest over poor payment rates and alleged embezzlement of funds by the management.
Parents of Kimuchu Secondary School in Thika paralysed learning on the first day of term in protest over what they termed as exorbitant charges.
Nurses strike, protest in Migori over non-payment of arrears.
Three houses were Tuesday set ablaze as hundreds of rioting tea farmers continued wreaking havoc in Kirinyaga County in protests over what they say is poor bonus payment.

A Muslim cleric died on Saturday evening after his vehicle hit an improvised explosive device (IED) in the Kenyan coastal county of Lamu, near the border with Somalia. Al Shabaab are the suspected perpetrators.
Hundreds of farmers demonstrated at Thumaita Tea Factory in Kirinyaga to protest over poor bonus payment.

Dozens of residents of Njoguini in Nyeri County Tuesday staged a protest in Naro Moru Township demanding a stop to a Sh35 million dam project. The residents expressed dissatisfaction with the location of the dam saying it is being built downstream instead of upstream.
Political rivals clash at a church meeting. Injuries not known.
Riots have rocked Mitaboni, Machakos County following the killing of five guards in a recent gang attack.
Road workers in Ichuni Ward, Kisii County protest over delayed pay.
A mob lynches a man suspected of child abuse.
Police clash with market traders in Isiolo. Three injured, including a police officer.

Police have gunned down a al Shabaab terror suspect and recovered two hand grenades in Vingirika (Diani) village, Kwale County. The suspect Mohamed Bakari was shot dead by Anti-terrorism detectives after he hauled a hand grenade at the officers.
Residents of Kiriko Village in Tetu, Nyeri County Sunday night lynched an armed robber after an attempted robbery as police recovered a pistol.
Police kill two al Shabaab suspects during a gunbattle in the Kisauni area of Mombasa.
One is dead following a fight between two rival communities Kuri, Isiolo County on 14/08.

More than 50 casual employees at Menengai Oil Refineries in Nakuru claim they have not been paid their salaries and they are subjected to poor working conditions. The aggrieved workers on Wednesday evening downed their tools and held a demonstration demanding settlement of their salary arrears.
A man from Pimbinyiet sub location is discovered murdered by suspected rival-neighbours.
Four police officers were injured during an attack by suspected Al-Shabaab militants who tried to force their way into the Basuba General Service Unit (GSU) camp in Lamu East on Saturday evening.

More than 20 houses were on Sunday night set ablaze by arsonists in Pimbinyiet sub-location, Narok County, escalating tension between members of two neighbouring communities following the murder of a man the previous day. Injuries not known.
Sand transporters have blocked Mombasa Road in Makueni County in protest of harassment from local government officials. The protesters caused traffic problems, but did not cause injury.
A vigilante mob beat a woman to death who they suspect of witchcraft near Kilifi.

Three people were shot dead [3 August] while five others were seriously injured when police officers fired on a mob that had forced their way into Bondo police station to lynch two women alleged to have stolen a baby.

Youths, wielding weapons, attacked a group of Chinese workers contracted to build a railway in Duka Moja, Narok County. The attack is related to a protest the previous day in which the group had demanded locals be hired by labourers. Injuries reported.
Youths protest after Chinese nationals had been contracted to build a railway rather than locals.
Suspected al Shabaab detonate an explosive at a police building injuring one officer.

A Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) convoy was ambushed after their vehicle overran an explosive in Fino Town, Mandera County. Between 6 and 10 causalities. Elsewhere in Fino on the same date Al Shabaab destroys a communication mast in Fino and engage police in a gunfight. Four injuries.
Coffee farmers cut down trees in protest of pay in Mukurwe-ini 'early this week.'
A KDF convoy runs over a al Shabaab-planted landmine in Ishakani, five injured.
Man found killed, throat slit and body dumped in rice farm in Thiba. Perpetrators not known but locals blame terror gangs.
Following the death of a man in a road accident area residents protest the errant driver.

assoc_actor_1: CORD: Coalition for Reforms and Democracy
notes: A journalist was seriously beaten and injured during [opposition] Cord [Coalition for Reforms and Democracy] leader Raila Odingas rally in Port Victoria, Budalangi constituency [western Kenya]. The journalist survived after police intervened.
Police raid a al Shabaab hideout, kill two suspects.
Following the arrest of their colleagues, boda boda operators storm a police station in Likoni and clash with police. Injuries not known.
An al-Shabaab suspect was killed in Kenyas coastal town of Lamu in a foiled dawn attack at a local police station. One officer was injured.

A suspected [al Shabaab] held at a police station in western Kenya grabbed a gun and shot at police officers, killing between six, leading to a hostage situation. Despite initial reports, the police force later revealed the shooter was likely a disgruntled police officer.

A man was shot dead while another injured on Wednesday night when gunmen laid an ambush at Pimbinyiet at the border of Trans Mara East and Trans Mara West Sub-Counties. The identities of the attackers as well as their motive is unknown.

Defusal: Military forces foil an ambush on a convoy in Lamu by identifying IEDs and detonating them. No injuries. The security forces are reportedly in pursuit of the suspected attackers in the area. The planned attack and subsequent security sweep took place on 12/07.

Six people were injured in a confrontation between ODM and Jubilee supporters in Mumias East constituency on Tuesday evening. The violence erupted after alleged supporters of the Orange Democratic Movement (ODM) allegedly defaced Jubilee party campaign messages and paintings on rocks on the Kakamega-Mumias road.
Police officers, on their way to Lamu, escaped death by a whisker after al Shabaab militia men attempted to attack their vehicle which was heading to Mokowe in Lamu County on Sunday.
A woman was killed while three others were critically injured when suspected Al-Shabaab gunmen attacked a vehicle between Fino and Lafey at around 7pm on Saturday night.

More than 100 Al Shabaab raided Diff Police station in Wajir on early Saturday morning, stealing firearms and bullets. They left one police officer wounded, and are believed to have escaped with serious injuries during an exchange of fire with officers during the 1 am incident. Al Shabaab gained control of the town after several hours of fighting. The Somali Memo reports causalities without number.
Tea farmers protest poor current market price of their product at Kiangai market.
Suspected [al Shabaab] was on Wednesday morning shot dead by police in Kibundani, Msambweni Sub County.
Protests in Eldoret following reported domestic violence in the area.
Protesters burned a police camp during a protest recent against extra-judicial killings linked to police.
Police shoot and kill a al Shabaab suspect in Kwale town.
Al Shabaab attacks and kills a civilian in their home in Mbuwani.

A group protests in Uhuru Park following the murder of a lawyer. The source claims protests were also took place in 'major towns and urban centres countrywide,' though did not make any specific names or instances.

Parents and members of Christians of Lutheran Church hold a demonstration on July 4, 2016 opposing a move by the Teachers Service Commission to sack principals in whose schools there were burning of dormitories at Boys High School in Kisii.

Six people were killed and scores injured when a bus plying the Mandera-Nairobi route was sprayed with bullets by heavily armed assailants between Wargadud and Elwak. Government sources believe the assailants may have been a local militia group, not al Shabaab, which was the initial suspicion.
Al Shabaab claims it has killed 6 KDF soldiers in an ambush attack on a base of Kenyan troops in Lamu Island near Somalia border. KDF denies either the attack took place or the causality figure.
Kenyan forces kill four members of al Shabaab in Milimani and recover weapons.
Students of Itierio Boys High School in Kisii burnt down seven of their 12 dormitories after their teachers refused to allow them to watch a football match on television.
Al Shabaab are reported to have struck Damasa border town and destroyed a Safaricom communication mast and a water pump using explosives. No reported human causality or violence.

23 June. A lawyer and a taxi driver who were involved in a court case over police misconduct were are detained by three police officers in Nairobi. Their bodies are found dead in the Ol-Donyo River days later.

assoc_actor_1: CORD: Coalition for Reforms and Democracy
notes: Police open fire on 'mostly peaceful' CORD protesters in 'Nyanza region', killing five 'since Monday' (source dated 22/06).
A widow and a middle aged man were shot with arrows at Daraja Mbili and Songhor areas over a land issue. The attack is a carry over of hostilities which began on 18/06.
A widow and a middle aged man were shot with arrows at Daraja Mbili and Songhor areas over a land issue. The attack is a carry over of hostilities which began on 18/06.
At least 300 tuberculosis (TB) and HIV/Aids patients in Isiolo protested against plans to convert a regional TB isolation centre into county assembly offices.
More than 200 residents on 21/06 staged a peaceful demonstration over what they termed as neglect by the county government.

assoc_actor_1: CORD: Coalition for Reforms and Democracy
notes: Police open fire on 'mostly peaceful' CORD protesters in 'Nyanza region', killing five 'since Monday' (source dated 22/06).
One dead and three injured when an ambulance hit a suspected al-Shabaab planted land mine in Hulugho.
Anti-terrorism police on 20/06 thwarted an attack and killed a wanted al-Shabaab fighter in the coastal town of Kwale.
Five Kenyan policemen escorting a passenger bus have been killed after al-Shabaab fighters ambushed their convoy in El Wak on 20/06. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.

assoc_actor_1: CORD: Coalition for Reforms and Democracy
notes: Police open fire on 'mostly peaceful' CORD protesters in 'Nyanza region', killing five 'since Monday' (source dated 22/06).
Two are dead in or near Kopere trading centre over a land control issue. Violence related to the land continued in the general area midweek.
Eight Kenyans have been kidnapped by the al-Shabab militants in the past month in the Alango and Kurokura (Mandera County) areas. Dates unknown, though the latest kidnapping took place on 10/07.

assoc_actor_1: CORD: Coalition for Reforms and Democracy
notes: On 15/06 CORD protests broke out in 'western Kenya' (exact location not known - coded as Bungoma) following the arrest of opposition leaders for hate speech allegations. The source implies the location was a reference to either Kisumu or Siaya county.

Protest in a Nairobi slum after footage appearing to show a pro-government legislator saying top opposition leader Raila Odinga can be assassinated appeared. Police fired tear-gas, protesters responded with throwing stones.
Students of Lamu Bujra Boys High School go on a violent protest after several other students were suspended over a disciplinary matter.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill an area chief in Kiambu during the evening hours.

An IED detonated at Mandera, near the Somali border on 11/06. No causalities reported. The Mandera County Commissioner said the incident, which took place at Border Point Three area near custom offices, had targeted security officers manning the border area and was likely caused by al Shabaab.
Jubilee supporters in Eldoret held a peaceful demonstration and condemned intra party political remarks that appeared to go against a pact between coalition affiliates TNA and URP.

Jubilee Coalition supporters carrying banners stormed into the Donnies Hotel, where [Coalition for Reforms and Democracy] was holding a meeting with different leaders. They demanded that the leader of CRD leave the county. Police dispersed the protesters.

assoc_actor_1: CORD: Coalition for Reforms and Democracy
notes: CORD protesters from Mathare threw stones at vehicles, forcing motorists to use alternative routes.

assoc_actor_1: CORD: Coalition for Reforms and Democracy
notes: CORD youths blocked all major roads in Migori Town and lit bonfires in protests against the Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission (IEBC). The protest began the following evening.

assoc_actor_1: CORD: Coalition for Reforms and Democracy
notes: Transport along the Kisumu-Kakamega highway was (06/06) morning paralysed after youths who are protesting against the electoral commission blocked the road at Kibuye.
Truck drivers block roads in protest of police harassment and insecurity on 06/06.

assoc_actor_1: CORD: Coalition for Reforms and Democracy
notes: CORD youths protest in Kibera.

assoc_actor_1: CORD: Coalition for Reforms and Democracy
notes: CORD youths blocked roads, lit fires and looted businesses in Kisumu in protest of electoral commission on 06/06. Two deaths reported, plus 26 other injuries. Security officers watched the protests from a distance, though it was later reported police were responsible for the two dead. Human Rights watch reports the police opened fire into a peaceful crowd.

assoc_actor_1: CORD: Coalition for Reforms and Democracy
notes: CORD protests in Migori during the later evening hours. The protest became violent the following day.
A group of students attack and kill a man at Abubakar Integrated Schools mosque in Tsunguli Village in Matuga Sub-County, Kwale County over allegations of witchcraft.

A convoy transporting Kenyan defence forces (KDF) was targeted in a roadside bomb explosion outside Liboi town near Somali border by suspected al Shabaab. The bomb blast has destroyed one of vehicles in the convoy, causing unidentified casualties as Kenyan military did not comment on the IED attack.
Police officers protest over unpaid salaries.

Students of St Pauls Kiwanjani Mixed Secondary School in Isiolo went on strike the morning of 31/05, destroying and stealing property. The students destroyed classroom window panes and looted electronics, computers, books and teachers laptops before police intervened. The violence was sparked after several students were suspended for drug use.

Armed men believed to be members of Al-Shabaab have killed three people in Kwale in Kenyas coastal region. The Kenyan government said the people killed were elders. Reports say that masked armed men arrived at the coastal town and hounded the people out of their homes and killed them in an open field.

Three Nyumba Kumi officials were assassinated by gunmen in Diani, Kwale County [coast region] on Sunday [29 May]. The perpetrators are believed to be al Shabaab. The three were killed separately, each in their homes.

Movement of forces: Forty-five members of al Shabaab are witnessed crossing into Kenya at Sugrow, Wajir County. One group of 13 was sighted headed towards Gerille, another towards Konton and another towards Gumarey areas of Wajir East.

assoc_actor_1: CORD: Coalition for Reforms and Democracy
notes: CORD members protest in Homa Bay, marching toward county election commission offices. Police intervene, 6 protesters were wounded. It is not known if the protesters were violent.

assoc_actor_1: CORD: Coalition for Reforms and Democracy
notes: Three people died during clashes which erupted during opposition protests against actions of the electoral commission in two towns. Two people died of gunshot wounds and 25 wounded in the western town of Siaya, and one from a head injury after falling over while running from tear gas in Kisumu. Police in Siaya opened fire 'in self defence' after 'a mob with catapults' approached a municipal office. Twenty-nine police injured in the clash. The actions of the demonstrators in Kisumu are not clear.

assoc_actor_1: CORD: Coalition for Reforms and Democracy
notes: CORD protesters demonstrate against the electoral commission in Mombasa. The protesters were dispersed with police tear gas following running battles between the two groups. Sixteen arrests, including the Mombasa County Assembly Speaker.

assoc_actor_1: CORD: Coalition for Reforms and Democracy
notes: CORD protesters attempt to gather at the capital to protest against the electoral commission but are quickly dispersed by police tear gas after the group blocked a road.
Police clash with electoral commission protesters in Kakamega on 23/05. Injuries not known.
Five people were shot by prison warders in Migori County during violent electoral commission demonstrations.

assoc_actor_1: CORD: Coalition for Reforms and Democracy
notes: Police used tear gas to disperse CORD protesters in the Kibera slum of Nairobi. Demonstrators responded by throwing stones.

assoc_actor_1: CORD: Coalition for Reforms and Democracy
notes: Three people died during clashes which erupted during opposition protests against actions of the electoral commission in two towns. Two people died of gunshot wounds in the western town of Siaya, and one from a head injury after falling over while running from tear gas in Kisumu. Police in Siaya opened fire 'in self defence' after 'a mob with catapults' approached a municipal office. Twenty-nine police injured in the clash. The actions of the demonstrators in Kisumu are not clear and may have been attacked without provocation.
Violence at Karatina market in Nyeri after rival camps of supporters of area governor and an MP (both of the Jubilee Coalition) clashed at a ceremony.
A group of women lynched a man who was suspected to have stabbed his wife to death.

assoc_actor_1: CORD: Coalition for Reforms and Democracy
notes: Police use tear gas and clash electoral commission protesters during a protest in Nairobi. Reports of excessive violence reported from police. Fifteen arrests reported.

assoc_actor_1: CORD: Coalition for Reforms and Democracy
notes: CORD protesters clash with police in Kisii on 16/05. The demos, which started from Kisii Hotel, turned chaotic when the protestors attempted to force their way into the IEBC offices. Fifteen arrested.

Several ODM supporters in Kisumu sustained injures after police broke up a weekly demonstration to eject Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission officers. It is not known if the violence against the protesters was blatant or intentional. No violence reported from the protesters.
Residents attack and kill a suspected robber in Buruburu on 15/04.
Four people were shot and killed while one person is missing as renewed inter-clan fighting erupted at Kachamcham farm, Kerio Valley in Elgeyo-Marakwet County.
